ResponsesInList.Title: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, We have a problem with embedded H5P files in moodle 4.1.7. These H5Ps are embedded in pages or other activities . Some of the H5Ps are displayed, others are not. In the latter case, you will only see an empty box instead of the H5P. If the H5P is not displayed, the following error message appears in Chrome DevTools ( <name> is a string of 40 digits and lowercase letters. It is different for each H5P file): `Uncaught TypeError: H5P.isEmpty is not a function at new H5P.QuestionSet(<name>.js)` I think these JavaScript files are specific to the content type ‚ÄúQuiz (Question Set)‚Äù. This is also the content type of all H5Ps we are currently dealing with. Nevertheless, it is noteworthy that the content of <name>.js is not always the same: Some files contain calls to H5P.isEmpty() , namely in H5P.QuestionSet() and in this.getCurrentState() . H5P.isEmpty() is precisely the function that was not found according to the error message. In other files, the code that calls H5P.isEmpty() is missing. The string ‚ÄúisEmpty‚Äù does not occur at all in these cases, although both of the above functions occur. Can someone explain what the <name>.js files are all about? In the browser, these are accessible via paths like /pluginfile.php/1/core_h5p//cachedassets/<name>.js . The error seems to have occurred a few days ago, after the H5Ps had been working until then. I wonder if we can (and should) make sure that in all cases a JavaScript file is created that does not call isEmpty() . I have read recommendations to empty the database tables h5p_libraries and h5p_libraries_cachedassets . However, this involved error messages of the type ‚ÄúH5P -> Unable to find constructor for ...‚Äù. Could it also be useful in our case? I assume that the tables will then be filled again - which brings me back to the question of why there are different versions of this JavaScript file. Thanks, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: I am no longer sure the JS is specific to a single content type. The <name>.js files start with the contents of transition.js , then there might be all code from h5p-joubel-ui , there's code for xAPI, lots of code for video playback, ... They seem to contain all JavaScript relevant for H5Ps compiled into a single file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: H5P was created at a time where HTTP/2 was not available and where each file that had to be loaded increased the overall loading time of a page significantly. That's why the H5P integrations bundle all of all the content type JavaScript/ CSS files that are required (unless explicitly told otherwise by setting `$CFG->mod_hvp_aggregate_assets = '0';`, don't know if moodle's custom H5P integration features something similar). Think of Course Presentation for instance - it has multiple subcontents which themselves have different dependencies that all need to get loaded. Those bundles are the files inside the `cachedassets` directory. Each file represents a bundle of all the JavaScript/CSS files required for a content type, so only two files need to get loaded per content type instead of dozens or even more. Those files are usually created the first time a content is viewed if I recall correctly. If you remove the files from the `cachedassets` directory (and ideally from the `h5p_libraries_cachedassets` table in the database, not sure if it gets cleaned up), the files will be recreated if missing. Do never delete anything in the `h5p_libraries` table, however! Don't understand why anyone would suggest that. Those table holds the list of all the content types that are installed including all kinds of information on them. You will need to reinstall them without their respective entries - that is why you get the `Unable to find constructor` message. Regarding `H5P.isEmpty`: That is a function in H5P's core that is run to detect (de facto) empty objects. If it is not found, then H5P core is not loaded properly - which has nothing to to with the cached assets.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Oliver! I‚Äôve reviewed all affected H5Ps, and here‚Äôs what I found: All working H5Ps use version 1.17.6 of the ‚ÄúQuestion Set‚Äù content type. They contain a directory H5P.QuestionSet-1.17 , with the following lines (among others) in library.json : `"title": "Question Set",` `"description": "Put together a set of different questions that has to be solved. (Quiz)",` `"contentType": "question",` `"majorVersion": 1,` All buggy H5Ps use version 1.20.12 of the same content type, while our moodle has both versions 1.17.6 and 1.20.26 installed (As I understand it, the latest patch version replaces older ones, while major/minor versions are installed side by side). About H5P.isEmpty() :‚Ä®Initially, I wondered if files with incorrect content could have been generated during caching. Now, I see that H5P.isEmpty() is used in version 1.20.26 of ‚ÄûQuestion Set‚Äú, but not in versions 1.20.12 , or 1.17.6 . Potential Compatibility Issue: Another observation is that in version 1.20.26 of the content type, library.json specifies coreApi version 1.26, while our Moodle uses h5plib_v124 . I wonder if this might cause compatibility issues. Fortunately, our h5p_libraries table is intact. We haven‚Äôt encountered the ‚ÄúUnable to find constructor‚Äù error recently, though I remember seeing it before.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, different versions of H5P content libraries can live side by side. Yes, if you're using version 1.24 of H5P's core then this is the cause of your issue. The `isEmpty` function was introduced with version 1.26 and is not available in H5P core 1.24. I can't tell, however, how you were able to install version 1.20.26 of Question Set as it requires H5P core in version 1.26 since version 1.20.20. The H5P Hub does not signal "Update available" if the H5P integration does not meet the core requirements. From what I know, Moodle's custom H5P integration (which does not feature the H5P Hub) uses the very same guard mechanism when fetching new libraries from the H5P.org server . And as far as I know, installing a library by uploading H5P content as an admin also would yield an error message - hence many people wondered why they could not upload someone's H5P content (that had been created with a content type using H5P core 1.26). The most obvious solution would be to use h5plib_v126, but I assume you would have done that already if you could - still Moodle 4.1? A simple patch would be to add the `isEmpty` function ( https://github.com/h5p/h5p-php-library/blob/master/js/h5p.js#L2143-L2164 ) to the h5p.js file that is hosted by h5plib_v124, but I am not aware if some other changes were introduced with 1.26 that might still be required. Instead of patching that file, pseudo-polyfilling that function in some extra JavaScript might also be an option. Once the H5P object is created, usually once `document.readyState` is `interactive` or later you could inject the `isEmpty` function as well. Here, you'd need to remember to remove that side-loaded JavaScript when you update H5P's core, or at some point it might cause trouble when the `isEmpty` function changes. You could also "downgrade" to Question Set 1.20.19 which is the last on to use H5P core 1.24 . That's possible "quite" easily, because the parameter structure of the content type is still the same. That would require to get the respective JavaScript files from the 1.20.19 tag ( https://github.com/h5p/h5p-question-set/tree/1.20.19 ) and replace the current ones, to change the entry in `h5p_libraries` (patch version from 26 to 19), and to clean the cachedassets, so they can be rebuilt. That should be it in this case, but I might have forgotten something. I'd not think this is a good solution though unless you can make sure that Question Set 1.20.20 won't find its way onto your platform. Seems to have happened before even though it should not have been possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you once again. We use the H5P integration of moodle. This also contains a mechanism that should prevent the upload of incompatible libraries, but apparently this is incomplete. We are still using moodle 4.1.7 4.2.1 and are currently preparing an update. After we added H5P.isEmpty() to /h5p/h5plib/v124/joubel/core/js/h5p.js , the affected H5Ps are working again. We did not have to empty the cachedassets directory or any database tables.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: Yup, cleaning the cached assets and modifying the database would only be required for the "downgrade" option that I mentioned, because the cached assets do not contain H5P core libraries. Glad it's working for you now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: Oliver wrote "...The H5P Hub does not signal " Update available" if the H5P integration does not meet the core requirements..." Where can I see the status of the h5p integration of my moodle instance? (I guess "Moodle core requirements" are meant) Sorry, I never heard of something like that in respect of Moodle plugins ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with embedded H5Ps: H5P.isEmpty is not a function in cached file
ResponsesInList.Text: H5P is not a plugin for Moodle only, but a framework that can be put into all kinds of integrations, and in order to be able to make it flexible to use in different contexts, it was split into different components. If you have a look at H5P's architecture , you will notice the term "H5P integration" which is what is commonly called a plugin, but Moodle's native H5P integration is yet another one. On top of that integration there's the "H5P core" which has nothing to do with Moodle's core. It supplies common functions that H5P content type libraries may require. The function `H5P.isEmpty` is one of those functions. It was introduced with H5P core 1.26. If content types need at least that version to run, but the respective H5P integration does not supply it, then those content types will not be available for use. The H5P integration would need to be updated to support that later version of H5P core. I don't know whether you're running the H5P plugin for Moodle (doubt that, because its latest version supports the latest version of H5P core and you'd probably have tried to simply update that one) or whether you're using Moodle's own H5P integration (with the blue icon and the content bank). The latter provides the H5P core as part of a separate plugin (H5P integration library) with v127 being the latest. It will give you - you guessed correctly, H5P core 1.27 which is required by a number of younger content type versions to run. Moodle 4.3.8 and 4.4.4+ provide it automatically, 4.2 is the minimum requirement for it to run. You can check what version of Moodle's H5P integration library is installed at "Site administration -> H5P -> H5P settings".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P is not uploading activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Hola Carolina! Thanks for re-posting your question here (as advised on the H5P forum). You say " I am using the plugin (blue icon) installed by me ". Actually the Moodle core H5P activity (the blue icon) cannot have been installed by you, it's part of the standard Moodle plugins so it's already installed when you install your Moodle site. Then you say " I have been trying to use the Bank content in Moodle to create activities ( black icon ), ... " Again you are wrong, H5P activities created in the Bank content can be used in your Moodle course by using the blue icon. OK, don't panic, you are not the first Moodle user to experience difficulties understanding how to work with the H5P activities. In my opinion (and I'm not alone) things are un-necessarily complicated. Here is my advice to take things from the beginning to get it to work. 0.- Are you the admin of your Moodle site, or do you have admin rights? 1.- Forget about the external H5P plugin (the black icon). If you can see that black H5P icon on when you try to add a new H5P activity, then it means that you installed that plugin. There is no need to use that . 2.- Take your time and read carefully the online Documentation for H5P here: https://docs.moodle.org/en/H5P and also here https://docs.moodle.org/en/Content_bank 3.- After you have understood the concept of "Content Bank", in one of your courses of your Moodle Site, go to the Content Bank page and check that you can see the whole list of H5P activities available here: the H5P Interactive content drop-list looks very short, but use the scrollbar to display the full list. If you can see (approx.) 40 h5p activities in the list, then you are set to go. Just click to select one activity, create it, and follow the Documentation help to put your H5P activities inside your course(s). If this doesn't work, come back here with more information... IMPORTANT Have you read this important notice: Important update: H5P content types version bump - Recommendations to avoid issues ? And finally, could you possibly update your Moodle site to version 4.5? One more thing, have you tried to create more simple H5P activities, such as Multiple Choice, or Drag the Words, etc. before trying the "complex" activities such as Interactive Video or Interactive Book, etc?

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P best procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I've used Moodle for years as well as the blue H5P quite a bit lately. However, after searching the forums, I can't find a description or specification of what's the best or an effective procedure to create, reuse, and safely save H5P activities within Moodle, Lumi, and your own computer. Also, I'm sorry to ask, but I can't see the advantage of Moodle content bank so far ... Thank you in advance. Luciana

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P best procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luciana, The content creation and editing is part of part of the H5P core used in all of the implementation should be consistent. Portability is meant to be a feature of H5P. I think the most important difference in the options is how the package files are stored and managed. The content bank provides a convenient place to store a content package so that it may be used in more that one place with out duplicating the file. A package in the content bank can be included with the filter in multiple locations or the file can be linked into activity using the Moodle file system using the content bank repository which is searchable. If you edit the package, changes will appear every the package is linked. These features are unique to the content bank implementation. If you do not need these file management features, it does not matter as much which implementation you use (the other implementations may be more straight forward because that lack these features).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error in mod hvp (h5p)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andy, The error message you're encountering‚Äî"Error: Call to undefined function str_contains()"‚Äîindicates that the PHP function `str_contains()` is being called in your code but isn't available in your PHP environment. The `str_contains()` function was introduced in PHP 8.0. If your server is running a PHP version earlier than 8.0 (like PHP 7.4 or earlier), this function doesn't exist, and any calls to it will result in an error. To resolve this issue, consider upgrading your server to PHP 8.0 or higher to ensure compatibility with the latest functions used by Moodle and plugins like H5P. Besides, you'll need PHP 8.0 or higher when upgrading to Moodle 4.2 and 4.3. HTH --C

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error in mod hvp (h5p)
ResponsesInList.Text: `str_contains()` rang alarm bells! Re: [hvp] Content throws "Exception - Call to undefined function str_contains()" > last para and the following posts. Worth reading the whole thread if you are hit. Possibly it has a happy end.

ResponsesInList.Title: Conditional Access to Quiz Results Based on Score
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Moodle Community, I‚Äôm looking for guidance on setting up an H5P quiz in Moodle 4.1 where students need to score at least 80% to see which questions they got wrong. The requirement is that: Students who score 80% or higher should be able to review their incorrect answers along with the correct answers for further learning. Students who score below 80% should not have access to any feedback or see which questions they answered incorrectly. I‚Äôve explored various settings and options, but I haven't found a straightforward solution that meets these criteria. Has anyone implemented a similar setup? Any suggestions or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thank you in advance for your help! Best regards, Danny Charland Account Manager | Catalyst IT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Conditional Access to Quiz Results Based on Score
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Danny from Catalyst, Short answer is : it can't be done with H5P alone. But... if you combine an H5P activity with the power of Moodle, you can get a workable result. Here‚Äôs a detailed approach to achieve this goal: First, create the quiz using H5P and integrate it into Moodle as an H5P activity. Make sure that the H5P content is set to record attempts (using xAPI if necessary) to accurately track scores. Then, use Moodle‚Äôs grading feature to record the results of the H5P quiz. This will enable you to use the grade as a condition for accessing feedback. Next, create an additional activity or resource (such as a page or file) that contains the correct answers or feedback on the students' mistakes. Use Moodle‚Äôs "Restrict Access" feature to ensure that this resource is only available to students who have achieved a grade of 80% or higher. To configure this, go to the resource settings, then to "Restrict Access," and add a condition based on the H5P quiz grade (e.g., Grade >= 80). By default, students with a score below 80% will not be able to see the resource containing the feedback, as the access restriction will automatically exclude them. Finally, make sure to test this setup with a student account to verify that the access conditions work as intended. This method leverages Moodle's conditional access features alongside the flexibility of H5P activities to meet the specific feedback requirements. By ensuring that grade tracking is enabled for the H5P activity, you can precisely control who has access to the feedback. HTH --C

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P error Unable to load libraries
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm getting H5P error Unable to load libraries

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  H5P error Unable to load libraries
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jaswant, And thank you for saluting the group whose members strive to provide free and voluntary assistance. The error message "Unable to load libraries" in H5P can occur for several reasons. Here are the most common ones: Missing or Incompatible Libraries: If the required H5P libraries are missing or incompatible with the current version of H5P, you might get this error. Incorrect File Permissions: If the file or directory permissions are incorrect, H5P might not be able to access the required libraries. Improper Installation or Update: If the H5P plugin was not installed correctly or an update was interrupted, some libraries might not load properly. Database Issues:

ResponsesInList.Title: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am currently bumping around H5P core, creating a small interactive book. I create 10 questions in the content bank thinking I could insert them into the interactive book. This does not seem to be the case. I can add to the interactive book page, a new question. But we cannot insert existing questions from the same content bank. Is that true? Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: Each instance of an H5P activity in the content bank stand on its own. But I assume you're talking about questions in the "question bank" instead of "content bank" : there is no connection between the two. The only way to reproduce content is, depending on the purpose : 1/ copy/paste the text into the new activity, OR 2/ copy/paste the h5p activity (the 2 buttons up right the edit window) and adapt the text for new use HTH C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Shirley. I haven't tried this with more recent versions and it is a really old fix - but... I remember this problem myself years ago and the solution was to turn off the 'filter once per page' setting - see MDLSITE-6269 Does that help?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: You can insert many H5P content type questions into Interactive Book, but not all (e.g. TrueFalse is not supported, but Multiple Choice is). The only interface for inserting an existing H5P into an Interactive Book is the copy and paste function of the H5P editor. Open one of the existing questions by clicking edit button in content band, click 'Copy' button in the editor, navigate to your Interactive Book and edit it, click 'ADD CONTENT' and the the 'Paste' button in the new content. The past button is enabled only if there is a compatible content type in the clipboard.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you that was extremely helpful! I knew it had to be possible...somehow. Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Book-Can I insert questions from the content bank?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P video creation
ResponsesInList.Text: To address your question regarding the creation of H5P content for use within the Moodle platform, it's important to know that you can indeed create H5P content directly within Moodle itself. If your Moodle site has the H5P plugin installed, you can create, edit, and manage H5P content right from within Moodle. This plugin integrates seamlessly and provides a user-friendly interface to work with H5P content without leaving your course environment. Additionally, as of Moodle 3.8 and later, H5P support is included as part of core Moodle. This means you have the capability to create and interact with H5P content directly within Moodle without the need for any additional plugins. This core integration also supports the tracking of student interactions with the content, which can be incredibly beneficial for educational purposes. HTH C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle 3.11 > 4.1, "hvp module doesn't exist"
ResponsesInList.Text: How did you add the hvp code? Normally the best way to do that is by coping the whole folder from the old installation into the new one. That way you make sure, you also have the old libraries ready (which some activities might be referring to).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle 3.11 > 4.1, "hvp module doesn't exist"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Matthias I installed the new hvp with ' git clone -b master https://github.com/h5p/h5p-moodle-plugin.git hvp && cd hvp && git submodule update --init' as documented in https://github.com/h5p/moodle-mod_hvp . Going back to the previous hvp was a good suggestion. I replaced the current hvp/ (in 4.1) with the one which was in 3.11 and it works! Initially it said something about a newer version installed, I forged the date of the plug-in in version.php until it was accepted. Now it goes. The plug-in screen says: Notice the wrong date 2023033000 which I forged. What does all that mean? I should NOT take (for my 4.1) the suggested version 1.23.2 (2023061200) as shown in https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_hvp/versions rather take this 1.22.2?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upgrading Moodle 3.11 > 4.1, "hvp module doesn't exist"
ResponsesInList.Text: After having copied all the old libraries, you should be able to install the newest version on top of it. Just as a precaution, save your database before doing so. You can then update all the H5P contents in your installation. As no old libraries are missing any more, you shouldn't face any problems. At least in my installations, updating to the newest version didn't cause any problems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all! I have a question regarding moodle's custom H5P integration. Does it really not feature a batch upgrade process for existing H5P contents? H5P libraries can exiist in different versions. Let's assume the latest version of "Mark the Words" was 1.0. I create some "Mark the Words" contents now. Then version 1.1 gets released and installed. If I now create new "Mark the Words" content, it will automatically use the 1.1 version. The existing content will not be touched however. It will still run version 1.0. So far, so good. If I wanted to upgrade my existing content to version 1.1, usually because the newer version has new features or relevant bug fixes, I have two regular options (with H5P Group's H5P integrations for moodle, WordPress or Drupal): I can edit the content and save it again. That will automatically migrate the content to the latest content type version available. The same happens if you upload content of an older version to a platform that already provides a newer library version by the way. I can run a batch upgrade to convert all existing content of some type to a later version. Now, while moodle's custom H5P integration implements 1), I can't find a way to do 2). Am i just too tired/stupid, or does moodle really not implement a batch upgrade process in its custom H5P integration? I mean, the general code is available, of course. It's inside H5P's core that every H5P integration uses, but an H5P integration must supply a user interface.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Oliver, I totally agree with your analysis and conclusion. A batch upgrade process for H5P contents is definitely needed in Moodle. I have just created MDL-80555 in the tracker and invite all H5P users to vote for it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph! You are really having a senior moment... üòídon't you remember you already posted the same request on the Moodle Tracker 3 years ago? MDL-70918 . I expect someone with a more alert mind will do something sensible on the tracker to fix your silly mistake. Have a happy New year 2024 anyway!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: That wasn't my conclusion I really looked for that option on the sandbox and didn't find it anywhere. Thanks for the tracker entry! But then my question really is: How do users of moodle's custom H5P integration handle upgrades? Do you simply ignore newer library versions? Do you really upgrade existing content manually one by one by editing/saving it? Didn't you even know about this issue?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Oliver, That's an interesting question. I only use H5P Core (blue) and I was never confronted with a lib version problem. I guess this should be automatically handled by the task "Enable the scheduled task ' Download available H5P content types from h5p.org'" which runs on cron. So if a upgrade is urgent, you should run cron manually to solve the problem. Please someone correct me if I'm wrong! Now you raised the topic, I had a check on the libs versions, and I see Moodle is keeping old versions as wel. I don't know if this is an attended behavior. Anyone having a clue ? TIA , C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: @Christophe, I'm afraid you have misunderstood Oliver's initial post. He is not asking about the automatic handling of updating H5P libraries, which is a task automatically run by the Moodle cron. He was asking about the absence of a feature to automatically update existing H5P contents when a newer version of the library/ies they use has been updated by cron. That is a different issue... To answer your question, as far as I understand (and with behaviour observed on Drupal and Wordpress), older versions of H5P libraries are kept available (and get displayed on the Moodle site /¬†Manage H5P content types) for as long as they are used/needed by contents which are using them. On Drupal , libraries which are not or no longer being used are clearly marked, so they can be deleted without fear of causing problems. On Moodle , it is not clear, because all content types and libraries have the Delete icon available! This is a real interface problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Joseph! Exactly what I meant. Meanwhile, I had issued a poll on the Fediverse and had blogged about the results including some evaluation of the results at https://www.olivertacke.de/labs/2024/01/13/h5p-and-not-upgrading-existing-content/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Oliver, indeed, as you wrote, I understand now that "However, updating libraries (by minor version jumps) does not upgrade existing content!". Thanks ! C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Doesn't moodle's custom H5P integration has a batch upgrade process for existing content?
ResponsesInList.Text: Joseph, thank you for your answer! C.

ResponsesInList.Title: [mod_hvp] mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all I upgraded the core of a Moodle 3.9.25 LTS to 4.1.8 LTS. Which was successful. Under the Available updates it showed me that (among other plug-ins) hvp has a newer version. So moved the mod/hvp/ away and got the latest https://github.com/h5p/moodle-mod_hvp by cloning. It kicked the upgrade script but halts at (with Developer level debug): Warning : require_once(/var/www/ DOMAIN /dev/mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /var/www/DOMAIN/dev/mod/hvp/autoloader.php on line 77 Fatal error : require_once(): Failed opening required '/var/www/DOMAIN/dev/mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php' (include_path='/var/www/DOMAIN/dev/lib/ pear :.:/usr/share/php') in /var/www/DOMAIN/dev/mod/hvp/autoloader.php on line 77 Indeed the new /var/www/DOMAIN/dev/mod/hvp/library/ is empty! The old one had a mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php. What am I doing wrong?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [mod_hvp] mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Vishi, three directories (editor, library and reporting) are Git submodules. They are therefore probably not included in the download zip. Get the three individually and put them in the spaces they belong. Best, Luca

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [mod_hvp] mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php missing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luca Thanks for the prompt support. Note that I haven't touched a zip, rather "got the latest https://github.com/h5p/moodle-mod_hvp by cloning". Do you mean, I need to combine many Git repos in to /mod/hvp/?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [mod_hvp] mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php missing
ResponsesInList.Text: It means that you need to clone the submodules as well by adding the `--recurse-submodules` flag to the git `clone` command.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [mod_hvp] mod/hvp/library/h5p.classes.php missing [RESOLVED]
ResponsesInList.Text:
RESOLVED I should have read the Readme in https://github.com/h5p/moodle-mod_hvp . === make sure that all submodules are pulled as well using: 
```text
git submodule update --init
```
 ... Development Version Warning! Never use the development version in production,
there are no guarantees for which state the development branches are in
at a given time. Inside your `moodle/mod` folder you run the following command: 
```text
git clone -b master 
https://github.com/h5p/h5p-moodle-plugin.git
 hvp && cd hvp && git submodule update --init
```
 === This is not the first time I stumbled upon this. Got the zip file from the plugins database - the matter is RESOLVED. Footnote: Ironically, this is by far the best example of what I am talking about here: A common branch names scheme for additional plug-ins?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duplicate H5P in content bank for template
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Melanie. If you're staying on the same machine, you can copy the content (button top right in edit mode), and past it in another activity. This will replace the activity content, even if not the same activity. For example, I can create a Multiple Choice activity, copy it, exit edit mode, create a new Accordeon activity (because this is the first in the list, easy to find), edit, paste and get the copied Multiple Choice activity which I can customise. HTH C.

ResponsesInList.Text: This is probably old news, but we found when we upgraded to 4.1, that all our content types where disabled. I had to go to the Admin General settings and make them all available again. I have no idea why this would¬† have happened though?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The content bank, H5P Add button is showing disabled
ResponsesInList.Text: Ho did you do that? I have the same problem (the Add button is empty), but everything looks OK in settings (all h5p features are allowed).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The content bank, H5P Add button is showing disabled
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, When first installing Moodle, the Moodle install package does not come with H5P activities pre-loaded. The process which loads the H5P activities afterwards is contained into a task (\core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task) which should run once a day. But for this, another process is needed : the Cron , which is essentially a little server programmed to keep running on the web server and executing the tasks on due time. And according to my own observations, the Cron is a part often forgotten when installing Moodle without the assistance of a professional... I hope this clarifies the process. HTH C.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can't 'get' activities in H5P Interactive Content Plugin [Moodle 4.0]
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Adam, It could be that the cron task , that picksup contenttypes has not 'run' yet. I noticed this with new installations, since the task frequents is like 1 a month, when you have a new install it does not straight away 'downloads'/ 'make the contenttypes' avaiable. If you are a site admin (or when not give them these instructions): Login to site Go to Server > scheduled task search for the task " Download available H5P content types from H5P.org (\core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task) if the column last run says "never' then click on the radar fill in at minute */1, the rest is * Save the changes Wait 1 to 5 minutes (it kind of depends on how frequently your cron is running) Refresh the page, check if column last run now has a data and time Click on the 'radar' again check thebox "Reset task schedule to default" Save changes Go to the COntent bank and check if you now see Contentypes. If this did not work, check with your technical team/server contantperson if the Cron is correctly configured. Redo the steps. I hope this fixed your issue. Gemma

ResponsesInList.Title: Best Practices for Combining Multiple H5P into a single experience?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I am have been given a large number of H5P files, some containing Presentations that are up to 20 slides and others that may be just a single activity. Many of the chapters in the course are made up of 3 - 10 H5P files. I would like the experience for students to be as seamless as possible, and not have to go back out to the course menu between H5Ps. I am looking for some best practices here. I will also need to be able to Restrict Access to future chapters until earlier chapters are completed. So, I need to preserve completion data - not for individual H5Ps, but for the collection that make up a chapter. I have some H5Ps that are quizzes. I'm fine with the quiz being a separate experience so that it can be graded on its own with no complications. I have seen some discussion about putting these all on a page, book, or lesson activity. Does someone have a resource for which method to use and why, or a pros / cons list for each, or something helpful in the way of best practices here? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best Practices for Combining Multiple H5P into a single experience?
ResponsesInList.Text: I created a blog post (and video) on how to embed H5p into other Moodle areas, which will help you go through the mechanics of how to do this: https://davefoord.wordpress.com/2021/11/05/moodle-tricks-of-the-trade-embedding-h5p-activities-into-other-moodle-areas/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best Practices for Combining Multiple H5P into a single experience?
ResponsesInList.Text: In addition to what Dave already mentioned, you could use the autolink or R√©cit autolink plugin to just link to your H5Ps from any Moodle page. The R√©cit autolink plugin has a setting where the H5P acitivity opens as a modal. My suggestion is useful when you don't want to many H5Ps in a page to load at once (strain on server ).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best Practices for Combining Multiple H5P into a single experience?
ResponsesInList.Text: My go to H5P tool is the 'Interactive Book' which is considered and 'Aggregator' Content Type (CT). The Interactive Books(CT) pages are Columns (CT) which allows you to put muliptly other Content Types(CT). It also has a nice table of contents that have indicators to mark completed or not similiar to the new v4.0 Course Index indicators. Plus the [Summary & subit] screen is very useful to know what is completed or answered correctly. So with a single Content Type 'Interactive Book' you could make a mini-course. We use this for student's study guides.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best Practices for Combining Multiple H5P into a single experience?
ResponsesInList.Text: I think interactive book is just the solution I was looking for. Thank you. Now just a bunch of copy paste work ahead of me!

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Core - multilingual content
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. I need to language tag two different languages in a course presentation, and other single H5P- activities like drag words as well. Is there a possibility to language tag two languages in text or activitity like drag words in a course presentation like this in H5P core Moodle: Her you see both Norwegian and Ukrainian text. This cause accecibility troble because Ukrainian is not tagged as language. Any tips are heartly welcome! Cheers, Bj√∏rn

ResponsesInList.Title: Svar: H5P Core - multilingual content
ResponsesInList.Text: No respons, so glad I found a solution. Visit "My account". There you should enable the "language" option. Then, in the authoring tool, you'll get a new button in the WYSIWYG toolbar, to use it you'll need to select the text and then select the language. Now I was able to add the language tags to the text. So - if any other wonder - here is a potensial solution. I hope this option also will be part of core H5P in Moode, so we don¬¥t need an h5p.com account to get the feature. Cheers, Bj√∏rn

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5p activities cropping to the wrong height in the mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dave, By design, H5P activities take the width and height available, which sometime leads to unwanted effects. You can go to the HTML code of your activity page, and put the H5P div into another div with a min-height style property set. This should do the work... HTH

I did a test with a couple of H5P packages and they seemed to work fine in the app, maybe it's a problem in the package itself. I recommend you to use the same H5P package but using the Moodle H5P activity (available since Moodle 3.9) to see if the same issue happens. The H5P integrated in Moodle has a blue logo and the activity name is just "H5P" instead of "Interactive content". If the same problem happens with the H5P activity integrated in Moodle, please send the H5P package to us so we can take a look. If it only happens with the mod_hvp plugin then you'll need to contact the plugin maintainers because this is a 3rd party plugin, we didn't develop it. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P embedding issues Moodle 4.1
ResponsesInList.Text: The reason why the sizing is off in your case most likely is that the H5P content iframe is put into another iframe (of whatever that is wrapping the H5P content - the extra "Complete the activity" stuff should not be part of H5P but of something else). The outer (root) iframe doesn't know about the resizing of the inner iframe and hence doesn't resize itself to make enough room for the inner iframe.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I download h5p content
ResponsesInList.Text: If the author of the content did not hide the action bar below H5P content and if the author allowed users to download the content, then you'll notice a "Reuse" button in that action bar. Click on it, and you should be able to download the content that you can then upload on other H5P enabled platforms (with sufficient rights). There's documentation at https://h5p.org/documentation/for-authors/import-and-export

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How do I download h5p content

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Where are the other knowledgeable programmers? and why aren't they helping to set the record straight? H5P was not designed for assessments (only). It should be (and is) usable for all kinds of contents and content for teaching and learning also goes way beyond the notion of assessments. B ut if high-stakes assessments are that crucial (I am not a teacher, I cannot judge) , then choosing client-side evaluation was clearly a design flaw. I don't know the background however, so I can't tell what the prerequisites were. Server-side evaluation is on the roadmap of H5P Group, but I don't thing this is going to hit the shelves soon, because it would mean quite some work to redesign the core of H5P and also existing content types. So, the answer to "Where are the other knowledgeable programmers?" most likely is at "H5P Group". There are not too many H5P developers outside of the H5P core team, at least as far as I now of. I also don't believe that the moodle team is going to invest resources. And my answer to "why aren't they helping to set the record straight" would be manifold: lack of documentation (for external contributors), lack of interest (the moodle team included H5P in core even though they knew it's using client-evaluation when they started, and they probably don't want to invest resources in "competition" that would make it easier to get server-side evaluation into other platforms, too), lack of funding (the number of developers who would work on this in their free is tiny), complexity of the project (many technical aspects, possibly even coordinate developers inside and outside of the H5P core team), ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: I am far more interested in learning than assessment and H5P is a wonderful tool for learning. Once the learning is done Moodle Quiz is an excellent tool for assessment (especially with the cool 3rd party question types like Gapfill, Wordselect and Formulas). However people should be aware of the key differences.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: In education, it is more and more about learning, for example with flipped classrooms. The harsh reality is that as long as there are report cards or grade transcripts and, for example, minimum levels of achievement for access to higher education, strict assessments will be necessary. So there is room for both types of questions. However, as Marcus said, people should be aware of the differences, which many probably aren't. As for me, I know now. I particularly thank Oliver for his openness and his explanations.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! H5P editors fill out a form that is structured by the semantics.json file (even if there's a visual editor used as in Course Presentation, in the end one fills out the form). That semantics.json file can easily be understood, in particular if you look at the rendered editor next to it. It's quite obvious that for "Multiple Choice" the answers field holds the answer options including the text and the correct state. The structure will vary from content type to content type, but the principle is the same for all of them. The H5P Core transfers all the parameters that were entered by the editor from the server side to the iframe on the client side by passing a JSON object that follows the same structure as semantics.json. You could retrieve that information as part of the `window.H5PIntegration` object as `window.H5PIntegration.contents[cid-<contentId>].jsonContent` directly from memory. Just try running `for (id in window.H5PIntegration.contents) { console.log(JSON.parse(window.H5PIntegration.contents[id].jsonContent)); } // no error handling` in the development console inside either the H5P iframe's context or its parent's context and explore the output. You could even find the answers without knowing about the semantics.json file ... You could do the same programmatically as well, of course. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Problems with Course Presentation
ResponsesInList.Text: This problem happened to us on the core version of H5P in moodle 3.9.9. Since the execution of the scheduled task \core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task in early may we have experienced various issues with H5P. When we try to add a new course presentation, we have various lines with things like [field:group:coursepresentation:presentation]. no errors are referenced in the web console. If we still try to create this content, we end up with an empty content.¬† This time, the web console have the following error : Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'slides') If we try to add the course presentation demo from the H5P site we can see this error message : Exception : Call to a member function get_content() on bool And these two errors in the web console : 1) Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 () 2) h5p.js?ver=1680857919:997 Uncaught ReferenceError: H5PIntegration is not defined We have versions 1.25.5, 1.24.14 and 1.22.11 of course presentation installed. We used to have other problems like infinite loading for previously created resources but we managed to fix that by uninstalling and manually reinstalling a few H5P components. We've had a lot of network issues on the day where the scheduled task \core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task executed so it's possible that we lost connection to the H5P server halfway through the task. H5P worked correctly before that scheduled task executed back in May. For reference, I've previously posted that same question on the H5P forums where they told me that the problem seemed to come from Moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problems with Course Presentation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Laurent, It seems the system cannot load the needed component, and your hypothesis of a disrupted scheduled task could be correct. One way to check that : run the task manually... For that : find the relevant task in the scheduled tasks click on the wheel to access the settings set al time/day fields on *. Keep only the minute one on */1 Run cron manually : in the site security settings, set " Cron execution via command line only" on "no" load the page https://[site.example.com]/admin/cron.php set "Cron¬†execution via command line only" on "yes" again Check execution : go back to the task page and check the last execution time for the h5p task if not set to now, run the cron again check if the h5p activity error is connected If done, don't forget to reset the execution planning of the h5p task. HTH Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Convert H5P content to a new content type version
ResponsesInList.Text: If you are using the H5P plugin for moodle, then you can upgrade all existing content of a content type on the library settings page (using the green arrow button). If you're using moodle's custom H5P integration, then I am not sure if there's a way to batch upgrade contents, but I assume (don't know) that at least the single upgrade process was ported: Edit the content that you want to upgrade and save it again. That should hopefully trigger the upgrade process for that content.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Plugin - Cannot upload new libraries
ResponsesInList.Text: When saying "online", I mean with access to internet, of course. H5P activities are not meant to work properly on closed systems. Your initial installation should have work with the packages it installed, but you went offline and tried to install another H5P package, which obviously contained dependencies that were not to be found on your installation. You state "All of the "missing" libraries are already in the package,", which is wrong. The package only contains references to those dependencies. If the right component in the right version cannot be found on your system, the package cannot work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag And Drop - Attempts report in Moodle 4.1 not okay (H5P Core)
ResponsesInList.Text: The H5P Drag and Drop (Drag Question) content type is considered by the XAPI reporting as a matching type activity. It can accept the following 4 types of matching: one to one one to many many to one many to many The H5P plugin report works as expected for all 4 types of matching. The H5P core activity report only works correctly for the one to one type! The source of the problem lies in the fact that those 2 reports do not follow the same procedure. I need to take some more time to write a full bug report and will post here when I've done that.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Core / M3.9.x | This file can't be displayed because it has been uploaded by a user without the required capabilities to deploy H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I am creating this forum discussion with as purpose: Documentation for those who bump into a similair issue. To get a better view on the reasons why this happend. The issue In some of our courses student and other uses saw the notification below. Background information We have 1 main course that 'holds' the contentbank. In a different course, we add the H5P core activity and add the contenttype from the 'main' course "link to file". We have users that have the capability to manage the contentbank (standaard Manager rol). What do we think happend We think that one of these two scenario's that could play a role in this: User account that created and then added the content has been deleted from the Moodle installation, and therefor the file could not find the right user anymore. we have not found any references to this issue on this problem. We also where NOT able to reproduce this scenario in the Moodle instances 3.9 with a test account. We also try to reproduce it in a clean Moodle 4.1 and where unsucusses full. There fore we have not created a Moodle Tracker , since we don't know if there was an underlining issues which makes it difficult to submit the proper reproduction steps. User account has switched a role, without the proper premissions and therefor lost the capability and/or ignored the warning. See tracker: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDLQA-14116 how did we solve it We reconnected the H5P contenttypes in the H5P activity. All the contenttypes where there, by reconnecting them we solved the message and the users could work in the contenttypes. - Gemma

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Core / M3.9.x - M4.1 | This file can't be displayed because it has been uploaded by a user without the required capabilities to deploy H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: I finally found a way to reproduce this error and I concluded it is due to deleting the user, but it was not what i thought it was Anyways I have created a tracker: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-77665 Login as admin/manager (an user that can create courses) Create a user named "Editing Teacher" Create a course named Contentbank Enrol 'Editing Teacher' with the rol Teacher (editing teacher) Create a course named: activity Enrol 'Editing Teacher' with the rol Teacher (editing teacher) Login as Editing Teacher Go to course named: Contentbank Go to¬† the contentbank Add a h5P contenttype, name it "File corrupt" (I used coursepresentation, with some random text) Go to the course: activity Add a H5P Core activity to the course named: File corrupt Click in package file on 'add' Click on content bank Navigate to the course where you have created the content choose 'create an alias/shortcut to the file' / Link to file Select the contentfile you created in step 3 click on save and display You should be able to see the content Login with an user with privileges to see all courses, deleted users and edit contentbank items by example a siteadmin/manager Go to the course: activity Click on H5P activity: file corrupt You should be able to see the content navigate to siteadmin > Users > Accounts > Browse list of users. Search the user¬†named "Editing Teacher" Delete the account Go back to course: Activity You should be able to see the content Go to course named: Contentbank Go to¬† the contentbank Click on content file named File corrupt Click edit Click save (you don't have to make changes) Go to the course: activity Click on H5P activity: file corrupt You now see the notification "This file can't be displayed because it has been uploaded by a user without the required capability to deploy h5p content' Edit the H5P activity Remove the content from the Package file Click in package file on 'add' Click on content bank Navigate to the course where you have created the content choose 'create an alias/shortcut to the file' Select this file You should be able to see the content

ResponsesInList.Title: content bank: teachers can only edit H5P of which they are author
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi We are
having a problem with our content bank. Moodle 4.1. Two teachers write a Moodle
course together. But they can only edit the H5Ps of which they are the first
author. Is a permission adjustment possible so that all teachers working on
that one course can edit all H5Ps of that course? What can our administrator
change? Thank you -SNT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: content bank: teachers can only edit H5P of which they are author
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, it is possible to adjust the permissions so that all teachers working on a Moodle course can edit all H5Ps of that course. To do this, you need to modify the permissions of the course and the H5P activities within the course. Here's how to do it: Go to the course page and open the course administration menu. Click on "Permissions" in the menu (appears in different places according to the version) In the "Roles with permissions over this course" section, select the role(s) of the teachers who need permission to edit all H5Ps in the course. In the "Override permissions" section, check the box next to "Edit H5P activity" to allow the selected role(s) to edit all H5Ps in the course. Click the "Save changes" button to save the new permissions. After these steps, all teachers with the selected role(s) will be able to edit all H5Ps in the course, regardless of who created them. Note that if you want to apply these permissions to all courses on the site, you can modify the permissions for the "Authenticated user" role in the site administration settings. However, it's generally recommended to modify permissions on a course-by-course basis to avoid unintended consequences.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P responses
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using the H5P activity module in Moodle, but I noticed that the responses of users are not being saved in the database table 'mdl_h5pactivity_attempts_results'. This is causing me difficulty in tracking the progress of my learners. I have tried checking the configuration of the activity module and also checked the database settings, but I still can't figure out what's causing the issue. Can someone please help me troubleshoot this problem? Moodle Version : 4.0 h5p version: What you are seeing is the worksheet format that I generated via sql command and export. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P responses
ResponsesInList.Text: I understand your concern but there at this moment too few informations available. Let's go through some common troubleshooting steps to help identify the cause: Ensure the H5P plugin is up-to-date: Check it on the h5p site. Check H5P activity settings: Some H5P content types may not save user attempts by default. Make sure to enable the "Save content state" or similar options in the H5P activity settings. This will ensure that user attempts are saved in the database. Verify user permissions: Ensure that the users participating in the H5P activities have the necessary permissions to save their progress. Check the role assignments and capabilities for the users in the course and verify that they are allowed to attempt and save progress for H5P activities. Inspect the browser console: Ask your users (or login as student) to check the browser console for any error messages or warnings when attempting an H5P activity. This could provide useful information about any issues preventing data from being saved. Examine server logs: Check the server logs for any error messages or warnings related to the H5P plugin or the database. This could help identify any issues with the server or the database connection that may be preventing the data from being saved HTH

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activity completion issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Are you using the H5P core activity (blue icon) or the H5P plugin (black icon)? Anyway, I have tried your scenario and ... everything works as expected. Create a H5P Question Set activity (black or blue) Set Completion tracking -> Do not indicate activity completion Student does the activity and gets a grade -> Activity is not marked as comleted In Teacher mode, change the activity settings to: Completion tracking -> Show activity as complete when conditions are met -> Student must receive a grade to complete this activity Student refreshes their course page (or they log out and log in again)... ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup course with H5Ps

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backup course with H5Ps

ResponsesInList.Title: Is it possible to upload multiple .h5p files to the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: It seems kind of weird that we have this "bank" of content, but actually importing content into it has to be done one-at-a-time‚Ä¶ I feel like I must be missing something. Can I upload loads of h5p files at once?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to upload multiple .h5p files to the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: Can I upload loads of h5p files at once? No, you can't. üôÉ This is due to the particular nature of H5P files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to upload multiple .h5p files to the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: What nature would that be?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to upload multiple .h5p files to the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: It is more a more of logical limit of the area to which the files are uploaded. The activities only are able to display one H5P at a time. The content bank displays the H5P after uploading so uploading multiple files would be confusing. Technically you can upload multiple files Into a Folder resource or the Private files block and move them on the server to content bank with a repository plugin. It is also possible to upload multiple H5P in a course backup and merge them into the course content bank. There is also a web service for adding content to the content bank that could be used to upload multiple files using a scripting language on the desktop.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to upload multiple .h5p files to the content bank?
ResponsesInList.Text: ‚Ä¶ but it's a bank of content. Surely actually rendering the content afterwards is purely optional? Seems like it would be a very sensible addition to Moodle. Maybe I'll throw together a ticket and PR. Yeah, I thought of using a web service, but it seems like the only services available are `core_contentbank_delete_content` , `core_contentbank_rename_content` and `core_contentbank_set_content_visibility` . Am I missing a trick here? We have some courses with a LOT of H5P content in mod_hvp and we'd dearly like to move all that content over to the content bank. It seems kind of crazy that there's no built-in method for doing this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Timestamp not updating in content bank repository
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I can't be the first one to address this, but I didn't find anythnig and didn't ask chatGPT. When updating a content in the content bank, the timestamp of the corresponding file in the repository is not updated. Bug ou feature?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timestamp not updating in content bank repository
ResponsesInList.Text: I think the "files" in the CB Repo that do not update are LINKS only to the original file contents that sit in the Content Bank. They - unfortunately - do not update their time stamps when the CB contents are updated, but retain the date/time they were originally created. The other disadvantage is that - unlike in the Server repository - the link files don't feature an overlay to show that - not even if you switch the CB Repo display list to "File icons". I think both are bugs, and I also think the "File details" view in the CB repo and Server repo should be improved and always include an overlay clearly telling the file listed is a link, and not an original content file. These checks above done under 3.11.11, but probably¬† the described Repository behaviours did not change with 4.0.* or 4.1.* .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timestamp not updating in content bank repository
ResponsesInList.Text: Need to correct my reply - apologies for any confusion caused. The Content Bank repository search as accessed from the File picker (in Moodle 3.11 at least) lists not the H5P package filenames (or links to those), but the "Content names" - the same ones shown on the course's Content Bank page. So, indeed, there's discrepancy in the timestamps between both displays - as "simple" as that, and that's an obvious bug to me. BTW - also tested for merely renaming a content in the CB - to the same effect : the last modified date/time¬† has been updated in the course's content bank, but not in the CB repository (Moodle 3.11.11, again). Anything else I wrote in my previous reply (about searching for (link) files using the Server files repo) is actually irrelevant to the original question. The file details view in the Server files repo would indeed benefit if there was an overlay arrow over the file type icon where applicable, but that's an entirely separate story.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P content doesn't display on the course page

The workaround is adding the text resource and embedding the H5P content in the Otto editor, then the content directly displays on the course page. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P content doesn't display on the course page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yusif, Is this behavior something new in your Moodle, or did you observe it earlier in other cases? Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P content doesn't display on the course page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christophe, This is new Moodle installation, latest version, and I tried it for the first time to upload H5P content.

ResponsesInList.Title: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I didn't observe this until now but this is an odd behaviour... To reproduce: On course page, go into edit mode Click on "Add an activity or resource" Select the H5P core activity (blue button) in the activity selector On the parameters page, give a title On the parameters page, drag/drop a H5P package into the "Package file" zone Save and return to course Open the Content Bank (Course main menu More > Content Bank) The H5P package we added is not there. Which is not the behavior you should expect and contradicts with the sentence on parameters page "Use the content bank (opens in new window) to manage your H5P files". This is also not documented on https://docs.moodle.org/401/en/H5P_activity . Any thoughts about the why? Is this a bug or is it useful? Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Christophe, I hadn't noticed this, but it is quite expected from my understanding. The content bank is like the H5P authoring tool and it only contains the activities that are created there or the ones that have been added manually there, it's not as sophisticated as an aggregator.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beatriz, Thank you for your reply! In my opinion is this behavior not intuitive, which is again another source of confusion in the use of H5P (see my other threat about this). H5P is scoring high in Moodle HQ's 2022 Integrations Surveys Results . Let's hope HQ will hear the sound of the cries of the users... Anyone other thoughts about the glitch I mentioned? Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: @Christophe, 1.- I agree that this is confusing. The sentence "Use the content bank (opens in new window) to manage your H5P files" should be removed from that screen, it's useless and confusing. 2.- There are 2 ways to add an H5P content when using the blue icon: a) directly dropping an H5P content created elsewhere (e.g. with Lumi) into the Files box; b) clicking on the Add icon, which takes you to the Content bank where, hopefully, you have previously created the H5P you need. "You can drag and drop file s here to add them " is wrongly formulated, since you are only allowed (of course) to drop one H5P file in that box. This should be re-formulated. 3.- I expect the Moodle programmers who integrated H5P into core could not make up their mind whether to only accept creating H5P course activities by using H5P contents previously created in the Content Bank or to provide an easy "shortcut" for using H5P contents created outside the Content Bank. Hence the regrettably confusing interface. 4.- Anyway, I agree with your original post question "where does it go?". If an H5P content (created elsewhere)¬† is inserted directly into a course activity it should automatically be made available in the Content bank. This would be coherent with the way questions are created and inserted into a quiz activity. Questions for a quiz are either created beforehand in the Questions bank where they become available to a new quiz, or created when a new quiz is created, and subsequently become part of the question bank and available to any new quiz.üòÉ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: @Joseph, 4 - good point : coherency with the Questions Bank ! Christophe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload H5P package into "Package file" on params page: where does it go?
ResponsesInList.Text: Forcing the #4 behaviour would have to mean that this H5P activity must use the "by reference" (linking) method. Dropping the file immediately into the activity (currently) means you do NOT want to use the Question Bank to edit but just load the file. I think there should be an option for the teacher given there: - Do you want to simply embed the package into the activity (without adding it to the Question Bank)? OR - Do you want to add the package to the course's Question Bank, link to it from this H5P activity, and be able to edit the package in this course's Question Bank? Or something to this effect.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P quiz results not showing in Moodle 4.1
ResponsesInList.Text:
I have a H5P Course Presentation, with a question in it, uploaded in a Moodle 4.1 course. The course format is "Topics format", with Enable completion tracking and Show activity completion conditions enabled. The courses are supposed to include more than one H5Ps, so I cannot use the "Single activity format". I am dealing with 2 separate issues: 1) When a student goes through the H5P presentation and answers the question in it, the result does not show in Moodle
in the grade book. I tried to upload the H5P as a Course activity and also directly into the Topic Summary with same result. The issue is essentially similar to this one, only I am using "Course presentation": https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=438975 Do
I understand correctly that in order to import results from H5P to
Moodle, I basically have to create a custom script which takes care of
the XAPI integration? Or is there another way? 2) When the H5P is uploaded as Topic Summary (not as Activity), can I somehow track that it was completed (viewed) by students (for instance, by going through all slides, or answering to questions)? Or the tracking can only be activated for Course Activity elements? If possible, I would prefer using the Topic Summary than Course Activity, as the student don't have to open the H5P, instead they would see its content right away. Any advice would be appreciated. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P quiz results not showing in Moodle 4.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Results will only be submitted once the students reach the summary slide of a Course Presentation. Might this be the issue? And no, you do not need to implement anything special related to xAPI. It's just an option to get way more information than you'll get from moodle's gradebook.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P quiz results not showing in Moodle 4.1

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P file size issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am dealing with H5P file size issue. I have a H5P presentation file that contains around 30 slides. The original file size of the complete presentation is 11MB, which seems to be appropriate. However, when I split it into 4 shorter presentations, each file ends up being between 5-6MB. I have observed the unusual behavior where the file size increases dramatically just after saving, from 2-2.5MB to 5-6MB. All the images and audio files used in the presentation are optimized, but I am unable to understand the cause of this issue. I am using Lumi as my primary H5P editor on Windows 10. Can anyone suggest a solution or a way fix it, or to decrease the file size of the shorter presentations? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P file size issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, Actually, each H5P content file contains not only the content itself (text, images, videos, etc) but also all of the libraries used in your H5P content (in your case, in your Course Presentation). If your Course Presentation contains a lot of H5P libraries, this would explain why the total sum of the sizes of your 4 "parts" is not equivalent to the size of the "course original" file! You ask "Can anyone suggest a solution or a way fix it, or to decrease the file size of the shorter presentations?" There is a way,¬† but this is not a trivial task. You'd have to edit your (parts of course) H5P files (which are just zipped files) and remove all the H5P libraries. But this is not recommended, as it would mean that you could only "restore" your files to a site where you are sure that the needed libraries exist. If you still wish to do so, please contact me at my e-mail address in my Moodle profile to discuss the matter. Joseph
