ResponsesInList.Title: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear All, This is a
very long post.. ¬†The matter seems more
global than H5P alone, but for the moment centres around Moodle users of H5P
and their support staff. I've been
trying to figure out how best to advise our users with copying courses with H5P
content. NOT an easy
task. It's
relatively straightforward (though I would not say friendly / robust) if a teacher
chose to add and embed H5P activities by using the COPY file option from the Content
Bank, or by uploading ready-made H5P content into the activity or embed. Such H5P
files are frozen to theist contexts, and when the activity is imported or backed
up and restored (separately or inside the course), a new instance of the H5P
content is copied into the restored / imported target. Why is this
not a dream solution? Because any update of H5P ¬†content requires re- upload of the file from
the computer (after editing in Lumi etc.) or else re-attachment of the copy from
the course‚Äôs content bank after it has been edited there. Too much hassle, easy
to forget all the steps. It‚Äôs so much
more convenient to link to the Content bank H5P file from an activity or embed,
and then, when an amendment is needed, to just go inside the Content Bank (via
the associated link in the activity when needed), and update / correct the
content. After saving, the post-edits will just get pulled into all
the linked places in the course. Great !
UNTIL you try to copy the course that relies on such linked H5P contents.. For even if
you backup the course with all the files and with the Content Bank, and then
restore that course in full as a new one, or if you use the Copy course
function, the restore will: 1) Restore all
the activities and the Content Bank files alright (with the same H5P content names
!) BUT 2) the links inside the H5P activities and embeds will link back to the CB contents
in the ORIGINAL course, and NOT to those in the restored course‚Äôs CB. And if you
happen to have used, say, 50 different H5P activities and embeds relying on such
links in the original location, then you are likely in trouble. Why? If you‚Äôre
like me, then it‚Äôs likely that each next version of the copied course will be a
bit different from the previous one, ergo you‚Äôll want to update your H5P
content a bit ‚Äì but without touching the originals from the past year. Hold on !
But my currently restored course H5P contents link back to the CB in my last year‚Äôs course
! And so do the H5P activities and embeds I used last year in that older Moodle course.. I can‚Äôt just go back to the CB from
2021 and post-edit the files, since this would also update my older course (that my students can still access), not just the
course I am creating now. There is no versioning of H5P packages to somehow fall back on. I need
to edit those H5P contents ¬†that are
in the restored course's CB. Well, edit those I can, but ‚Ä¶ the files in the CB there are not linked with the restored activities and embeds. Aaargh! How do
I now change/refresh all those link associations? How much more time will I have to spend
on that ..? For those determined, here‚Äôs my step-by-step
workaround for ‚Äúrescuing‚Äù an H5P activity with a link to H5P contents in an
older course‚Äôs CB: 1) In your RESTORED
course, click on that H5P activity‚Äôs name on the course page 2) Go to its
‚ÄúEdit settings‚Äù 3) Click on
the ‚ÄúAccess the H5P file in the content bank (opens in a new window)‚Äù link ‚Äì to
open the original course‚Äôs Content Bank 4) in
Moodle 3.11 at least ‚Äì in the breadcrumb navigation you will see the name of
the H5P package, (which is usually different from the name of the file itself -
another missing detail in the CB ‚Äì we often need both names to identify a given
H5P content precisely) 5) Copy
that name (if you forget, there‚Äôs another chance in Step 7 below). 6) Click on
the cog settings icon, then on Rename the content 7) Highlight
and copy that name (if you forgot or could not in step 5 above), then (I suggest) change
the name by appending something at the end , e.g. ‚Äú_OLD‚Äù or last year‚Äôs
school/academic year ‚Äú_2021-2022‚Äù etc. ¬†The
point is to later be able to identify which instance of the H5P content is
older and which is in the restored course‚Äôs CB, when searching through the CB repository.
Click Rename to confirm. 8) Close the
CB editor, and close this window / tab. 9) Go back
to the restored course‚Äôs edit H5P activity‚Äôs settings page (which you left off
at Step 2). 10) Click
on the ‚ÄúLink to X‚Äù alias name in the Package file upload area. 11) DELETE
the (link) file, and confirm the delete (don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì until you have saved the
activity‚Äôs Edit settings page, all these changes are temporary, if you make a mistake,
you can back out and cancel at the bottom. In any case, we are only deleting
the LINK here, not real content files) 12) Click
on the package upload area to bring up the File picker. 13) Make
sure you‚Äôre in the Content bank repo 14) In the
search area paste the name of the H5P file copied in step 5 or 7 above (without
the appended part), and hit Enter 15) You
should see two or more versions of this H5P content ‚Äì they will show the same
file details (Last modified dates, size etc.), but one of them will have the ‚Äú_OLD‚Äù
or ‚Äú_2021-2022‚Äù appendix at the end ‚Äì according to what you entered in Step 7
above 16) Click
on the file WITHOUT the appended part in the name ‚Äì this is the file sitting in
the ¬†Content Bank of your newly restored
course, not in the original source 17) Keep
the ‚ÄúLink to this file‚Äù option, click on the ‚ÄúSelect this file‚Äù button. 18) Scroll
to the bottom ¬†of the H5P activity‚Äôs Edit
settings page, click on ‚ÄúSave and display‚Äù to verify the result. 19) The H5P
contents should open and you should be able to view them. 20) To
verify that the link is really that to the H5P content of the restored course,
and not in the original source course, click on Edit settings again, then on
the ‚ÄúAccess the H5P file in the content bank (opens in a new window).‚Äù ¬†link . This time the link should lead you to
the Content Bank of the restored course (inspect the nav details around) . Note
the name in the breadcrumb nav (or else go to Edit > Rename, note the name ,
but don‚Äôt change anything, just Cancel). Close the CB editing . In the Content
bank that will pop up, you should now see the name of the H5P content file and
the number of linked places ‚Äì it should stand at 1 rather than zero (which is
what it was after the course was restored). If you have a long list of H5P
files here, you can find the right content by typing / pasting its name into
the Search box. ( BTW if you compare the URL of the ‚ÄúAccess the H5P file in the
content bank (opens in a new window).‚Äù link in the H5P activity edits , and that
to the found H5P resource in the CB, this should be the same link, with the
same id number at the end) Now that is
how we have updated the H5P contents link for just ONE H5P activity in a
restored course. The same steps need to be repeated for all the others..
Tedious, wasteful, irritating, although probably my instructions could be simplified here and there. ALAS, with embedded
H5P‚Äôs the situation is even trickier ‚Äì there is some trial-and-error involved: 1) Open the
restored Moodle activity / resource that contains the ‚Äúold‚Äù H5P embed, go to the
(Atto) editor area, double click on the H5P grey box to get the ‚ÄúInsert H5P‚Äù
popup 3) From the
URL copy text box copy the filename ‚Äì from the end to the last (first from the
end forward slash) 3) Click
Browse repositories 4) In the Content
bank ‚Äì UNFORTUNATELY ‚Äì you cannot search for the filename‚Ä¶ You need to click on
likely H5P content candidates (it helps if the names suggest the H5P activity
type!) , and then inspect in the SAVE AS box what filename the selected Content
¬†will propose to use ‚Äì it MUST PRECISELY match
the filename you copied in Step 3 above. (You can use Ctrl-F in the browser and
search the modal page for the filename string to verify that it precisely
matches your search keyword.) (Actually
after you‚Äôve found the right file you may change its save as name , but keep
the .h5p extension of the file. Maybe only slightly modify the main part of the
name, appending a date or part of the current course's short name? These are just
suggestions.) 5) With the
right file in the URL text box, be sure to leave ‚ÄúLink the File‚Äù in place (since
you will want to be able to edit the H5P content and to automatically refresh the embed via the
course‚Äôs Content Bank !) , and click the ‚ÄúSelect this file‚Äù button . If you
haven‚Äôt changed the name (Save as, step 4) , then when prompted to overwrite,
choose Overwrite or the other automatic Rename option. 6) When returning
to the Insert H5P modal window, click the ‚ÄúInsert H5P‚Äù button 7) On
returning to the Edit settings page of the Moodle activity / resource , save the
changes, then visit the resource / activity to verify that it works as expected 8) Visit
the Content Bank of your course to see how another zero count of linked places
has changed to 1, or else incremented by 1. (at the same time the number of linked
places for the related original file in the original course should decrease by
1). The
procedures could have been simpler/quicker if Moodle and its H5P core plugin: - displayed
both the H5P content name and the filename together in the Content Bank and in the Content back repository ‚Äì
especially when fixing the restored embeds, it is important to know which H5P content name corresponds
to which H%P filename; - if the
Content Bank repository search displayed the course name for the found H5P
contents , and/or allowed the user to only search the Content Bank of a
particular course, not all the courses they teach and have H5P‚Äôs in. Most of
all, however, or rather on top of the above, I strongly believe that Moodle should
clearly tell the teacher how it is processing the H5P content when copying /
backing-up+restoring a course ¬†-
especially in the case of those H5P activities and embeds which rely on LINKS. Moodle
should also allow the teacher / manager to: - UPDATE such
links when copying a course, so they point to the same CB contents that are
being copied / restored from the original course into the target course, and
PREVENT the link updates if the user has unchecked the option to include the
Content bank in the backup / restore; - keep the
existing / original links (as is done now) - BUT with the warning that these
links will point OUTSIDE the newly restored course), and give the additional option
to exclude the Content bank from the restore since these files will not be linked
to the restored activities. Altogether,
unless I have seriously missed something, I believe I have described here a major inadequacy in the way H5P / content bank contents are treated when copying courses (not
to mention copying and restoring courses between different Moodle sites !). The system
should allow the teacher (and manager) to see exactly what‚Äô s going on, and to maintain
control over that. My description
is based on Moodle 3.11. Is it any better in Moodle 4..? I have not tested, but
I'd be surprised. I hope that
this post will be found helpful, and maybe taken into account to improve the
H5P and Content Bank experience in Moodle. I can provide some illustrations if needed, open a
tracker issue etc. I wonder if
other users / admins have encountered ¬†similar hurdles, and whether they have perhaps
found other ways or golden rules to stay out of trouble.. Kind regards, Przemek

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Przemek for this thorough overview. I too discovered this only after cloning a clorose that had about 40 H5Ps a few times. So I now use the old "black" H5P plugin and the "H5P filter" to embed the activity inside other Moodle activities. This has worked very well - only downside is that I have 40 stealthed H5P activities on my course page (which get lumped into my progress blocks so I have to always unselect them).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, John. Glad you are managing in your way. I never used the black plugin and consciously avoided H5P's in our Moodle's until the core plugin arrived - I feared migration problems. We also don't have stealth enabled, though this is probably irrelevant for me. Using a hidden topic with all the needed H5P activities "made available" and linking to those might work, but - again - the core H5P plugin only accepts post-editing inside the Content Bank, so I would be stuck again. One improvement to my scenario I have thought of could be to visit the CB of the target course as a first step after the restore and to rename all the copied, yet unlinked H5P contents in one sitting (by appending the same recognisable sequence to their names), so they appear recognisable at once in any CB repo searches. Sadly the renaming is not quick to achieve - one needs to open a package for editing, click rename from the cog settings, confirm, and close - 4 clicks per single content file. Too many. AND there is no way to search and rename the actual h5p (link) files until you try to re-link a given H5P as an embed - from what I have seen. (Unfortunately, h5p files are not included in server repo searches.) Overall, however, I think until some better file management options are added to the Content Bank, I will advise our users not to use links in H5P activities and embeds, but to use copies from the Content bank (or uploads from the computer). If they use CB for editing, then they simply must remember to re-attach that file to the activity. Luckily, existing attempts appear UNaffected by such updates / replacements. BTW - The "Linked places" counter included in Moodle 3.11's Content Banks is useful, but it counts ALL the existing links to the content, also those from outside the current course. We see the count, but we may have no idea as to who and where is linking to that content.. Is it just ourselves in another copied version of the course, or maybe our former co-teacher who has searched and decided to "re-use" the content for another course they are teaching. "Unlisting" a resource can prevent linking by non-owners of the content (so should perhaps be a default) - though a former co-teacher will of course be able to download a copy of a H5P file in co-taught course and to re-use it elsewhere (which I have no problem with, as this issue is down to pure work ethics; though I also know that is some cases the Owner meta-data gets changed to the current user).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Przemek, I have encoutered the same problem in Moodle 4, unfortunately. My solution is to choose a content bank from a different course (that never gets copied) as the repositpry for all h5p content. That way h5ps don't get copied into duplicated coruses without ever being linked to (taking up server space without any function) and I can manage them from this central place. If I want to make an update to an h5p video quiz, I'll copy the file in the reference course content bank, add a number to the h5p file name and link this revised h5p version to the target course as well as the course's template. I am not sure why Moodle doesn't provide the option to make these links relational (always linking to the content bank of the same course where the activity is located) rather than static to a specific location in Moodle space. Thanks for bringing this up

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Przemek, I am not sure if I fully understand your 'frustration' but to answer your question is it any better in 4.0. I think it is from what I have tested. I have a course called H5P in this course with various H5P content files, using either the H5P blue option where the file is NOT linked, file is linked √≥r embedded on the page with the Atto. As you can see - with the restoring the course it copied the full contentbank to the new course, regarding the 'solution' that is been used. What I noticed is : 1) The h5P activities where I used 'link to file' are linking to the MAIN course, as I wanted to because that's where i want to do the changes - thoughI would had NOT expected those contenttypes in the contentbank of the 'copied' course due to server space. But on the other hand, in your case you might just want to do that, because if you want to alter something you can easily use this file WITHOUT overwritting the orginal. That said it would be very convint as they would do the same with they activity dupliciteit functionalit, add something like "copy" behind the name so you KNOW it is is a copy of an orginal file. 2) The H5P activity where I used "copy" file, are now liking to the file in the Restored course. 3) Embedded files are 'linked' to the restored course file. To improve this experience a little bit more my suggestion would be that: when an h5p contenttype is already created and retored from a previous course the H5p contenttype name will have the addition 'restored' (or copy). Gemma

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Christel and Gemma for your replies and suggestions. @Christel - yes, the "repository" approach would work, and some teachers or course coordinators are likely to do (discover?) that possibility. It's nice to be able to save server space this way, I agree. However, this scenario should not be imposed on (unsuspecting) users. There should be - like you say - an option to choose an absolute vs relational link to H5P contents when copying courses, at some point, when backing up the course TOGETHER WITH the Content Bank (for which there is a tick box after all). I'm glad we're on the same page here. @Gemma - I think you have a similar scheme to Christel's - a dedicated "master" course with H5P activities in it, some of them not using links to its Content Bank but directly using uploaded H5p packages. The latter of course pose no trouble for backup and restore; and if you want to refresh the contents in a new course with such "all-in-one" activities, you can replace the uploaded H5P file (most likely bypassing the course Content Bank's editing capabilities). This approach works also with linked H5P - when all you want is re-use exactly the same "classic" contents sitting in your Master course's Content Bank. Re: "(2) The H5P activity where I used "copy" file, are now linking to the file in the Restored course." - yes, that is what I would like to achieve - but being helped by Moodle's backup+restore UI. Right now I can only do this manually , and I first have to rename all the restored H5P Content bank contents by myself (4 clicks a piece), Too much hassle and too much time wasted (especially if you also want to train others how to use H5P's contents flexibly). I do like your suggestion that the copied / restored course's Content Bank should have the original names adjusted - with sth like "(copy)" (or a smarter suffix, maybe time stamp?) appended at the end . I would go further and suggest that the server file itself (which is often named differently than the content name) should also receive the same suffix. This way I would always, wherever searching or linking, be able to distinguish the original "master" sources from any later copies. Summing up , an improved scenario for course backup / restores involving H5P with links could perhaps be: 1) if the option to include the Content bank in the backup WAS checked when backing up a course When restoring the course, Moodle could ask if the Content Bank should also be restored (and if the restored course activities should link to the restored CB contents): - if Yes, then Moodle would re-create the CB, rename the H5P content names and files (adding "_copy" suffix or whatever), and re-link all the H5p activities and embeds to these copied equivalents; - if No, then: -- if the restore is being done on the same Moodle site as the backup - Moodle restores the course preserving the links to the original course (as is done now) (AND informs the user briefly about it, including reporting the name/link to the master copy course/s) -- if the restore is being done on a different Moodle site - Moodle does NOT (easily) accept the "No", but advises to restore the Content bank and to update the links in the restored activities. User could turn this down, and proceed at their own risk (at the end Moodle would, again, list all the broken links plus names and links to the Master course/s). 2) If the option to save content backup was NOT checked when backing up a course: - Moodle restores the backed-up course ON THE SAME SITE retaining the original links (as is done now). (Again, it would be nice if Moodle informed the teacher about it - that there are H5P activities in the course, and that original links will be preserved that go OUTSIDE OF the restored course. That master / source course + link should be listed in the feedback for the user to see it.). (Actually Moodle could even at this stage offer to pull copies of the original H5P contents into the new course's Content Bank ..., and use those in the linked activities - if the user wanted and where the originals are retrievable server-side, respecting all the permissions, public/unlisted status of original H5P contents etc.) - If the restore is on a different Moodle site - Moodle WARNS the user that the course contains H5P content links that come from outside of the current Moodle and that they CANNOT be retrieved . The user could then decide to keep these activities (at their on risk), or not . The list of original links , and names and links of courses they come from, would then be posted on the screen at the end of the restore process) The above would be - more or less - characterise an ideal user-friendly scenario for me. For a start, I would be satisfied if just the parts marked in bold above could be implemented.. All this still mostly based on my Moodle 3.11 experience.. I have yet to explore Moodle 4 more; we're not migrating there this year. Thanks again for all the feedback. Przemek

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: I did some testing in Moodle 4.0.4. My tests did NOT point to much difference from what I'd experienced under Moodle 3.11. Repository search and file server search make it easier to locate / associate a given content and file, but that's it. For H5P activities that use links to course's Content Bank, when I backup and restore as a new course / into an empty course, the links continue to point to the original location even if I do include the Content Bank in the backup and then restore. Moodle offers no option to either preserve the original links or to update them relatively to the copied+restored content bank contents with the same names. There is thus - currently - practically NO point in backing up a course including its Content Bank contents since these are NOT going to be assigned to the restored activities. The only indication that the copied Content bank is an orphaned copy are the zero counters for "linked places". The teacher who does want to make use of the copied+restored content bank must manually change the linked file inside each restored H5P activity or HTML embed, one by one.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I explain how we have been able to solve this problem (in Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona), without accessing activity by activity, in case it can be useful to someone. The changes are delicate (test before in a test environment) and access as a database administrator is necessary. Observing in the table m_files ( mdl_files ), the entries that have as file name (field " filename "), " %.h5p ", and the field " component " is an activity (" mod_% "), or course ("course", label in a section ) we saw that there are entries in which the " referencefileid " field is set to " null " and others have a numerical value . The ones that have a numerical value are the ones that use a link from the activity to the package. On the other hand, the ones that have the field set to null are the ones that use a copy of the package in the activity itself. The first are the ones. when restored through a backup of the course, when accessing them they show the error indicated in the first post, instead, the second ones (those with the referencefileid field set to null, that is, the activity has a copy of the package, not a link), when restored, they work correctly. Thus, changing the value of the referencefileid field to null in the m_files table of the source environment, converts the link into a copy of the package, allowing the transfer of the activity to a different environment, maintaining correct operation. ... Things to keep in mind ; - We found entries that had the referencefileid field with a numeric value, which when converted to null stopped working in the source environment. It was due to the fact that the file size field of these activities was 0. To solve it, we looked for the entry in m_files, corresponding to the package of the content bank of that classroom, and we copied the value of the file size and contenthash of said entry, to the first one (we did a script). - By converting the link into a copy of the package, the advantage of being able to edit the package in the content bank is lost, and that the changes are transferred directly to the activity... but evaluating the pros and cons, we thought it would be more convenient to apply this change (there were classrooms with more than 100 H5P activities). - Before applying these changes, test in a test environment...¬†üôÇ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions
ResponsesInList.Text: Risky, so not for me, but thanks for this investigation and the report. I'd love to have Moodle ask the user restoring the course what to do with linked H5P's (especially if the course's CB is included in the backup / restore): (1) keep original links, (2) change (where possible) the original to ones relative to the restored Content Bank contents, or (3) convert links to copies of the original files. Your fix implements that last option. For me, and I believe for most teachers - the best scenario is #2 - since links to the course's CB would enable editing of the restored H5P contents directly (with)in the restored course's CB.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activities with links to CB vs. copying courses - a frustrated teacher/manager‚Äôs story, a workaround and some suggestions

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Why oh Why can I not create a H5P activity in Moodle 4.0?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Brad, If you don't see contenttypes when you click on "Add" , then the Cron has not picked up any contenttypes yet. To check this go to site administration > Server > Scheduled Tasks Look for the task " Download available H5P contenttypes from h5p.org" If the cron task has no dates, or dates in the future you could choice to run the task manually. (please be aware that not all hosting companies gives you access to this). More information on the cron ( https://docs.moodle.org/311/en/Cron ) and running individual task ( https://docs.moodle.org/311/en/Scheduled_tasks#Running_individual_tasks ) can be found on Moodle.org

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Math expression in H5P; Cornell notes
ResponsesInList.Text: Both your question that you also posted on the H5P forum have already been answered there. Please try asking at one place first and only ask at another place if you do not get a satisfactory reply. Your approach may be convenient for you, but please keep in mind that you are using resources of other people. LaTeX : The H5P plugin for moodle (green/black icon) and moodle's custom H5P integration (blue icon) are two separate things. They do not share libraries, and you will have to install the MathDisplay library for the one that you want to use LaTeX with. Cornell Notes : moodle's custom integration does not support H5P's "save content state feature".

Sometimes bug fixes get released within hours, sometimes within days, sometimes it takes way longer. The frequent updates that were mentioned usually only cover new translations or some changes to existing translations files. Downloading the zip file from github may work for older content types, but normally the repositories hold the plain source code that needs to be built and packaged before it can be installed. If you want to try that, you could read https://peter.baumgartner.name/2021/04/12/h5p-library-installation/ for guidance - BUT make sure to read the comments, too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Video Glossary in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I am trying to create a glossary of words with video. The idea is that clicking on a word will display a video. In the past, this could be done in Flash but that technology is now deprecated. I want to know if something similar can be done in H5P. Thank you very much for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video Glossary in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Why don't you use the Moodle Glossary activity?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video Glossary in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: H5P's logic is based on single exercises that contain everything that they need in order to run. If you wanted to support a glossary in H5P content, every single content would require to contain all the material for all the words that should be "highlighted". I'd call that madness. One could use a service to provide a central storage for the videos and include the material in H5P content at runtime, but then you'd essentially lose the cross-platform sharability of H5P, require to have an open or authenticated third-party service, or to create versions of that service for all the H5P integrations. Simply does not sound feasible. Ooor H5P core would need to learn support for such a feature. Don't think that's likely.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Video Glossary in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Understood. That's the perfect answer. I'll try to make it some other way in Moodle. Thanks a lot!

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Score not record in moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: I created an H5P course with some questions at the end. I uploaded it to Moodle. Once a learner attempts the course, the score should show in the moodle under 'attempt record'. But it does not show the score(see screenshot1). Even not on the grade book. I use the integrated plugin in moodlecloude. 1). Why is that? How can I overcome it? 2) I want to know each learner's response to each question. How can I get it? (Not shown under 'View Report'-Screenshot 2.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Score not record in moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: The grading information is passed from H5P content to Moodle via XAPI statements. XAPI can communicate a very broad range of information, but its implementation is optional for H5P developers. Not all content types convey the same information. Moodle makes certain assumptions about what is sent, but if some key messages are not sent by the content it does not record the grade. The behavior will depend on the content type which you did not specify. I do not know what you mean by a 'course'. Is that with an Interactive Video with questions included? If so, it may work to embed the Interactive Video inside a Column content. The individual questions may emit XAPI statements to report individual answers, but Moodle does not look for those because they would be very content type specific.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Score not record in moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Course means a H5P content i developed. I used the BRANCHING SENARIO content type. I understood the reason the score was not recorded in Moodle. It's when I'm designing the content, I didn't select SCORING OPTION properly (shall select as Dynamically calculate from user answers). Once it was corrected, Moodle started recording scores in the grade book. But still looking for an answer for 2nd part of the questions(view score separately); as you mentioned it may not feasible. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: backup and restore h5p core course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi¬†Hussein Allaham! Thanks for reporting this and adding some screenshots to understand better what you were explaining Regarding the issue you faced when creating a backup with H5P activities containing a link to the content bank and then restoring it in a new Moodle site, I've just added a comment in https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-31094 . If you want to avoid the previous error, you should review all the H5P activities using a link and replace it with a copy of the file. If you have created these H5P activities using the migration tool, there is one setting to create a copy, instead of a link, which in your case might be more interesting (the recommendation is to use link whenever possible, especially because usually people don't migrated data from one site to a different one). The content bank has one capability, "Manage any content from the content bank (moodle/contentbank:manageanycontent)", that by default is enabled only for Course creators and Managers that you can give to your teachers if you want them to edit any content in the content bank (not just the one they have created). I hope this helps Kind regards from Barcelona, Sara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: backup and restore h5p core course
ResponsesInList.Text: I described a possible workaround here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=424426#p1720914 I think my method works. It is possible to re-link / re-embed the files if we clearly name them in the original course and include the filename info as e.g. in the H5P activity description field (or somehow else keep this info as a teacher's note). I'm assuming that the links point(ed) to the Content Bank files within the original course. On the use of copies rather than links to the course's Content Bank files: unfortunately in this way it is no longer possible to post-edit the H5P. One would have to manipulate the file outside of the course's context - e.g. download the file, use Lumi to open and edit, then re-upload and replace in the activity / embed context. Cumbersome... I have of course voted for https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-31094 , and would encourage all H5P Moodlers to do the same . For a sensible workflow within Moodle - this feature is a must-have.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: backup and restore h5p core course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, This should be quite simple? It would appear that you already have what you need? Now open each H5P activity, delete any file uploaded / linked there, and add the appropriate H5P file from the course's Content Bank, whether file or copy. You simply have to know which one to choose - on the basis of the info from the backed up course. Your files are consecutively numbered, so perhaps this is all the info you need to make the right choice. HTH . Good luck, Przemek

ResponsesInList.Text: Were you able to get backup/restore to work with h5p?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Backing Up and Restore courses with h5p activities
ResponsesInList.Text: FYI - From what I have seen there is a problem with H5P embeds and activities when you LINK to the original in the Content Bank (alias). If you store a copy, restore works. (Though of course linking makes major sense because editing of H5P can only be done in the Content Bank...) A workaround would be to ALWAYS CLEARLY NAME those H5P activities which are linked to. Then - after restore - you should be able to mend the broken links. Maybe even now, in the courses you moved, there will be some hints in the embedded links that will tell you out the H5P file's name you can try to re-link . It's unfortunately much worse in the case of activities - here the aliased file disappears completely, and so there's no hint - unless you remember which activity it was, or can check back at the original course location.

ResponsesInList.Title: Superscript in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear H5P Experts, I am facing one problem while writing a certain abbreviation in H5P. The abbreviation (omega squared)¬† requires superscript (2) but it is not happening in H5P. I copy the text written in Word in H5P then its all ok, but when I click on save the superscript is removed and it appears as normal text. See the following 2 images: 1. The text in Word. Superscript is fine. 2. Image from H5P - Superscript is removed upon saving.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Superscript in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: That's because Word and webpages actually use a special code to produce the superscripted 2. The easiest way to fix it is to replace the 2 with the corresponding unicode character: ¬≤. If you have a lot of instances, do a search and replace in your word document before you copy the text. You might also have a look at https://h5p.org/mathematical-expressions in case you are using the H5P external plugin and you need more complicated mathematical formulas.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Superscript in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: "I copy the text written in Word in H5P then its all ok..." You should really avoid to copy-paste text from an advanced text editor (such as MS Word) into a basic text editor (such as the CKEditor available in H5P activities ). By doing so you are copying and pasting a lot of formatting tags which a basic text editor cannot interpret. Unfortunately you do not mention which H5P activity you are using in your example. I suppose it's an Interactive Book, and maybe a Text sub-content? Can you confirm? There are very few H5P activities that feature the "sub" and "sup" tags in their editor toolbar, e.b. MULTICHOICE, INTERACTIVE BOOK, etc. I am attaching an example of a MULTICHOICE question editing. PS.- Just saw the workaround suggested by Matthias Giger, which does work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Superscript in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Giger and Rezeau, Thankyou very much for your valuable help. @Giger, yes, unicode of superscript 2 worked and solved my problem. See the pic attached. @Rezeau, yes, very well spotted. I am using Text option in Interactive book in H5P. Upon your suggestion, I tried typing with superscript option in Multiple choice question. There it worked fine. But then I copied and pasted the same in Text editor, there superscript vanished leaving it to be a normal character. I think since Text editor doesn't provide the option of Super-Subscript that's why upon saving all the characters become of same size. But anyhow, Giger's idea worked and I am sorted. By the way, thanks for suggesting point (1). I will take care of it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question set - why scroll bar?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Beatriz, Did you find a solution to this? We‚Äôre having the opposite issue to John: the scrollbar appears for our students but not admins ‚Äì it isn‚Äôt easy to consistently replicate but means that for many students the end of the question or the check/finish buttons are cut off and you have to scroll to see them. We did an update to Moodle 3.9 last week and since then a style class (highlighted in screenshot below) has been automatically inserted into the iframe of every H5P we have embedded (in addition to the width and height info that was there before) ‚Äì we don‚Äôt know where it is coming from as it isn‚Äôt in the original H5P embed code. We can‚Äôt edit it or delete it ‚Äì Moodle always just changes it straight back to what it was. While we‚Äôre happy for the width to be set to 100% if this means the H5P is responsive, the given height apparently can‚Äôt be changed: sometimes we are left with a height of just 147px so the students are left with a tiny iframe window through which to view the quiz, which is understandably frustrating! Please can anyone advise on how to make H5Ps consistently responsive so they appear without the scrollbar, or at the very least remove/edit the new style class in the iframe? Thank you in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Question set - why scroll bar?
ResponsesInList.Text: To clarify the issue, on the body of the picture above the HTML code shows that a script is being loaded h5p-resizer.js. The script should call a function after the content loads that changes the height so that bar does not appear. Either it is not called at the proper time or has a conflict with some other javascript . It may be helpful to look at the web console to see if there is something unusual there. It looks like you are running the older contributed activity module mod_hvp. It is possible that the Moodle 3.9 implementation is also trying to load the same script a second time and that is causing an error.

ResponsesInList.Title: Problem with Moodle/H5P Drag-and-Drop in iOS
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I have a problem with an H5P activity in Moodle: Course presentation with Drag-and-Drop exercise. A drag item (a small image) is to be dragged onto a spot in the background image. When I open the task in the browser on an iOS device (iOS 15.5; ipad or iphone; Browser Safari or Firefox latest versions), I can edit the task as expected. (The drag item can be dragged onto one of the drop zones. The task will be evaluated correctly.) However, if I choose an incorrect answer on the first try and then want to repeat the task, not only is the drag item moved, but also the content of the screen in the background . As a result, drop zones "disappear" to the left and are no longer visible or selectable. The drag item can no longer be placed correctly. The task can therefore no longer be processed. I've tried whether you can get to the destination by holding and dragging the drag item, for example, or by tapping the drag item and drop zone. But that was not successful. The problem does NOT occur with MacOS, for example on a Macbook. The problem under iOS is documented in a small video, which is attachted here. (Background: Users expect us to solve the problem. Switching to the Moodle app is not a solution the user wants. They also don't want to work without drag-and-drop exercises. The user is faced with so many iOS -devices used that a change to other devices is not possible.) I would be very grateful for hints on possible causes of error or possible solutions. ResponsesInList.Title: Are there any issues after Moodle upgrade - transition to H5P Plugin to H5P built-in plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, we are upgrading our Moodle from 3.8 to the latest version. 3.8 v don't have built-in H5P, we hvae installed the H5P plugin. My question here is...do we face any issues if we upgarde moodle to its latest version which already have buil-in H5P. Does our data reflect automatically after upgrade or we'll loss our H5P data? Do we have to keep using H5P plugin to retain the data after moodle upgrade?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Are there any issues after Moodle upgrade - transition to H5P Plugin to H5P built-in plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle's own H5P version works independently from the H5P version you already have in use. While there are plugins which allow the conversion from the original H5P plugin to the Moodle version, it is probably a good idea to continue using the original version for the meantime. Once you are familiar with both version, you can make an informed decision whether to use only one version or keep both versions around.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P attempts report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Amy, The attempt options settings can be found when you add an H5P activity to your course (not when you embed H5P content in other activities via the H5P button in the Atto editor). For more details, please see the documentation H5P activity .

There should be a button labeled "{}" which should unminify the code on clicking, and then the exact position of the code where the error happens should be highlighted. That's what should point into the direction where the actual cause is. The error message itself seems to be PHP related though, so if you by any chance have access to the server 's PHP error log, having a look there might help as well. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Content bank imported to a new course
ResponsesInList.Text: There are known problems with embedding H5P in Moodle questions. You should be able to embed H5P in a quiz activity description and overall feedback with the H5P Atto plugin. I believe this will work the same as with other activities. However, this method does not work to embed in the question text or feedback. This does not work because questions have to add additional information to the urls to check permissions which are not consistent with the H5P player. To embed an H5P in a question either and filter or a hard coded iframe must be inserted. If the link contains an item id in the old course the will not be updated by restore and students have access only if they can access the old course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Content bank imported to a new course
ResponsesInList.Text: As an admin or teacher go to page where the page where content is to be displayed. In the menu where you find 'Edit settings' (gear in most 3.x themes) for mod or course there should be a link to 'Filters' a little below that. If you click this, you should see a list of available filters and status of each. Display H5P should be on. In the backup and restore or import process there is an option to copy the filter settings. I noticed this is not checked in your screen shot above. Checking that may help in future.

ResponsesInList.Title: Does core H5P have "Save Content State"?
ResponsesInList.Text: I wanted to know if the "Core H5P" (in Moodle 3.9, blue icon) has a "Save Content State" feature. The H5P plugin (black icon) has a setting for this. I ask because we're using the new Cornell Notes H5P activity and the student's text content does not save when a student exits the page. In the non-core version, the content would save at scheduled intervals as defined the H5P site admin settings, but I don't see anything for this in the non-core. I've had a student leave the page up for about 8 minutes before navigating away and when they returned the text was no longer there and there was no record on the teacher's end -- they would see "View all attempts (0 submitted)" still. This is an activity added directly to and access from the course page with "Enable attempt tracking" set to "yes" and "Review attempts" set to "Participants can review their own attempt". Thank you,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does core H5P have "Save Content State"?
ResponsesInList.Text: Simple answer is No .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does core H5P have "Save Content State"?
ResponsesInList.Text: In addition to what PapiJo already said: Cornell Notes is not supposed to track submission of texts. Its sole purpose is to store them on the server and to retrieve them later on, e. g. for revisiting content (and one's own thoughts) when preparing for an exam. And one extra note: I have added a "save" button that will allow to manually trigger saving in addition to auto-saving (the "save content state" feature is still required though) and a "copy" button that will export the notes to the clipboard. The H5P core team has been informed that they could update Cornell Notes on the H5P Hub.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does core H5P have "Save Content State"?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm OK if the core's H5P Cornell Notes only "stores the text on the server and to retrieve them later" - how do I get that to happen? It happens with the "save content state" of the Non-Core version, but nothing is saving for the student at all in the Core version despite how long they have the text on the page before navigating away.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does core H5P have "Save Content State"?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John! There currently is no way to do that if you are using the moodle core integration of H5P. The moodle team has not yet implemented that feature. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: no submit button
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Selma! As you'll see in https://h5p.org/node/1239525 , there is a bug in H5P so you need to upgrade H5P content type libraries in order to guarantee it works again. If you're using H5P in core (blue icon) We recommend you follow the instructions in https://docs.moodle.org/en/H5P#Manage_H5P_content_types and run the scheduled task Download available H5P content types from h5p.org. ResponsesInList.Title: H5P attempts list does not respect groups
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm using Moodle 3.11.5. We have a large number of users from different institutions, so consequently we use groups to ensure that teachers cannot see details of students in other institutions. The H5P attempts list does not respect groups, so teachers can see attempts from students in other institutions, which is clearly unacceptable. We've had to remove the permission for teachers to be allowed to see any H5P attempts for this reason, which is a pity. There is a tracker item here https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-71662 which was created last year but it doesn't look like anyone is working on it. This seems to me to be a serious privacy issue - surely all Moodle features should respect groups if separate groups are set and teachers do not have the permission to access all groups. If you agree, please vote for the tracker issue and comment here so that this can be addressed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P attempts list does not respect groups
ResponsesInList.Text: +1 from me . I have voted for the issue to be resolved. I believe all H5P users among us should vote there. Moodle is still struggling a bit with how it treats groups in various contexts, and this is one of the areas - quite critical, I agree. Thanks for pointing out the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P attempts list does not respect groups
ResponsesInList.Text: Voted up. This is a deal breaker for my clients in the EU where we have to have those groups work properly to comply with privacy law. So, turning the report off is the only current option.

ResponsesInList.Title: Next/Prev activity links are not refreshed once H5P is graded
ResponsesInList.Text: The activity navigation links (shown at the bottom of an activity) are not refreshed after a H5P grade is saved. If the next activity is restricted conditionally based on the score (or pass/fail) of the H5P, the link to the next activity can vary and is not immediately refreshed once the H5P is finished. The only solution is to have the student go back to the course overview page or have them refresh their browser so that Moodle unlocks the correct restricted activity. Has anyone else ran into this issue or know of any way to solve it? It was confirmed by the development team that this is a bug, but I would like to see if anyone has any workarounds! This is for a self-guided learning course and I would like to move the student in the correct direction after finishing a quiz in H5P. If the student performed well (let's say over 75%), then I want them to move on to the next topic. Otherwise, another practice activity in the same topic should be shown. I am hoping to achieve this without having the student go back out to the course overview page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Next/Prev activity links are not refreshed once H5P is graded
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't believe this is a H5P specific issue. You are talking about activity completion, and restrictions. It's important to understand that completion activity is not "instant" because it relies n the Cron job of the server . So in this case, where you want almost instant changes in completion status, you would want to set your Cron to run every minute.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P edit via contentbank works only once (Moodle 3.11.4 )
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Bram I send you a PM with my emailaddress. Okay if the uploaded a demo course presentation from the tracker and works, then this rules out issues with the theme. Could you check in the 3.3.6 environment: if the course presentation in your Moodle 3.3.6 is the same library version as you use in your M 3.11 site? When the version on 3.36 is lower then on the 3.11 this might be the reason you have the current issues. You could update the course presentation content type by using the "green arrow" button if you have newer versions installed. If that is not installed, go to on of your H5P activities , select the course presentation contenttype and check if there is an update available. 3.36 site administration >Plugin > Activity modules > H5P > H5P Librariers 3.11 site administration > H5P >¬† manage content types In 3.3.6 check if there is a plugin update available for H5P? If so check if the versions is compatible with your 3.3 site and update. Some Moodle hosting providers placed a comment line in the config.php file that avoids Moodle to take the full H5P contenttype files into the backup. This has been done to avoid issues with backup/restore. But if they have placed the comment line in your enviroment then this could be one of the reasons you get this error. As in response to your other questions: 1) See above, check these points. 2) You can disable the H5P core plugin by going to Siteadministration > Plugins > Activity modules > manage activities . I would not advise to uninstall it t.b.h. 3) This could depend on the theme you are using. Check if it does appear when you switch to Boost thema¬† by adding ?theme=boost to your url. (See documentation: https://docs.moodle.org/311/en/Allow_theme_change_by_URL ) 4) I don't think you will avoid the issue with a different Moodle version, since it clearly works on the demo sample you used. The issue seems to be in your H5P file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P edit via contentbank works only once (Moodle 3.11.4 )
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Bram Good the hear you got it working again. The "bell" is the Moodle notification systeem. If you don't want to use it, you can disable it at Site admin > Messaging > Notification Settings. If you uncheck the box "web" the notification bell will disapear in your header. If you don't want to use notification at all, you can disable Email as well. You can see in the same screen what kind of notification are being send through the notification system. I mostly advice not to disable the email expect for Moodle sites that by example just being used as a LTI Provider/Tool. Gemma

ResponsesInList.Title: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I have added in each of my lessons a H5P Activity, that uses a H5P Question Set. Sometimes, when the students finish the Quiz, it take too much time to change the status to "Passed", and since the activities are connected together, the student cannot do the next one. Has anyone an Idea how to fix this? Thanks a lot.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: Completion data, like many other aspects of Moodle, is controlled by the scheduled task = cron job. These days that should be set to a couple of minutes, probably 5 at maximum, unless your site is absolutely huge. So you should maybe take a look at how often the cron job is running now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stuart, thanks a lot for your reply. I noticed that my server dosent allowd cron jobs below 15 min, this is why I'm running them now externlly every minute. And the system status in Moodle shows that they are running well. But I still have this problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: After a student complete a H5P Quiz, it takes too much time to change the status to done.
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess you may be on a shared hosting system then, if Cron is restricted to 15 minutes. So you have setup an external server service to trigger Cron remotely. You also need to check that the specific scheduled tasks around completion are not too long. I just checked on Moodle 3.11, and they appear to be default at ASAP (result being they should calculate on each Cron run), but I'm not sure about earlier versions, they may be set to 5 minutes for example to spread out the load. Might be some H5P scheduled tasks worth checking also.

ResponsesInList.Title: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: is it possible to replace the black H5P icon visible in the courses with various thematic icons, e.g. Course Presentation, Flashcards, etc ...?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: That's not possible because the icon displayed on the course page is the Moodle activity icon. which is the icon representing the H5P activity. However, I have often thought this would be an interesting enhancement. Having said that, the icons are (usually) displayed so small it may not really make much difference. I guess the overriding issue though is that you might add an H5P activity, say a single choice question. And then later you change the question type used. Moodle would not have a way of 'looking inside' the content, so now the icon might be incorrect/misleading. So in many ways it's safer to simply indicate to users "This is an H5P activity ... of some type" I guess it would be possible for Themes to override the actual H5P icon, which might be nice, with an icon that signals "interactivity" in some way. Stu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: This is an interesting request. Something like this is done in the External tool activity ( LTI consumer) In that course module there are settings that allow the LTI provider's logo to be used as the activity icon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, it does. Also, I think a theme could do this since each H5P activity has a "mainlibraryid" in its settings, which tells you what type it is. If it had the icons in the theme pix folder, problem solved. Themes override the standard activity icons all the time, one of their many virtues.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: I made a quick proof of concept on my plugin demo site . You can look there to see it working now. It is technically feasible. However, would it lead to a better experience for users?¬† It may be more difficult for teachers to see that this is an H5P activity for example, but might help students associate activities with similar experiences. Would there need to be options to turn this on and off either in the site or in the module settings?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel This request seems to align with a MUA project proposal I did in 2019: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-64952

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, but this is less general in that it would still use a predefined set of icons. The teacher would not be configuring the specific icon used. It does bring up something I had not thought of. The changes would need to be compatible with themes that map icons to font awesome. The H5P icons are svg only. I would like to know why it would be advantageous to have different icons. I think each icon should have a consistent meaning (current icons allow us to easily distinguish quizzes from assignments for example even if teacher makes a bad title choice). In the case of H5P I am not sure how important it is to know the main library. Several content types have a similar appearance or function. In the LTI case above, I think separate icons make sense. They are usually configured to to the logo of the provider. This allows the provider to brand and indicates to the user that they using different outside sites which may involve different privacy policies and licenses. Actually the H5P icons are useful in this forum to distinguish core Moodle from contributed H5P modules. If both used content type icons that would be lost.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: The reason for different icons/images that can be used is that the icons is not much meaningfull for a student. Think of the H5P activity icons, what does it tell the student? Do they even know what H5P is... changing the icon to something that is meaningfull for the student so they recongize that what they have to do with what it shows, helps students not to get confused and helps the course view to be more attractive.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree the H5P icon is wonky and black and blue H5P is double wonky. Few people know what they mean. Would changing to the individual content types improve the situation? Currently these icons appear only to teachers in the content bank or the third party editor or on the H5P web sites. It is unlikely students are familiar with them already, but are they intuitive enough to help or a distraction?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a good question. On some of my Moodle sites we even cssed out the icons because the students found them confusion and/or institution thought they where a distraction. I think that each institution looks at this differently depening on their vision on learning, how things should look etc.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: Daniel, I agree with Gemma and Jacek on the usefulness of individual icons: just like the standard icons, they are useful in to indicate the type of activity or resource the student will be doing. For example, we now distinguish file icons by type, docx, pdf, etc. - based on mime types - for the same reason: it gives both visual information as to the expected type of content and also helps provide a visual anchor or signpost when scrolling in the course. Icons for mime types have long been an internet defacto standard. This is the same sort of thing for the same reasons. Currently just knowing that something is any "H5P activity" means little to a student. That's similar to saying "This resource is a file." which is true but not important. As Gemma said, how useful this would be would vary. I think this would be very useful for K-12 situations where H5P activities can be the most common type of activity in a course: having a visual differentiator is very useful. Likewise, in my experience, this is common in some disciplines such as Language teaching were many H5P activities of different types are in the same course. Currently, there is a fixed set of mime type icons that you can draw from to change such icons, but if you want to use any others, you have to go to the server to do that. That's not exactly the same thing as the H5P library types, but it is a model to draw from for sites that may or may not want to adjust such H5P icons. Food for thought that you don't have to reinvent the wheel for that part if you think of them in a way similar to mime type icons.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Icons in H5P
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm thinking having H5P activity icons with a "H5P" overlay could be a useful solution. It's not students only but teachers as well who often need to quickly recall what sort of activity a given link represents. Speaking of which , also the labels displayed on mouse-hover - whether on the course page or in the Content Bank itself - might actually also prompt the name of the H5P activity type. In the Question Bank it would actually be useful to have a filterable separate column with the activity type names spelled out. Reviewing the Content bank by merely eying the icons is not handy.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with displaying in Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: H5P is HTML5, so will size to it's container (e.g. the page width) - unless you are using some code to set a width.

ResponsesInList.Title: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I was wondering if I could use the H5P plugin in our Moodle to host H5P content that can be used on other websites? This would be instead of going down the route of a paid hosting package on H5P.com. In testing I have not been able to display H5Ps on other websites (using the embed code). Is this by design or can I enable our Moodle to host external H5P content via a settings/config change somewhere?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nick, This should be possible if the users have rights to access the pluginfile. This usually means that it is part of a activity that has guest access enabled. I think that means you would need to enable auto login guests on site, add guest access to a course, and make sure guest can preview activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel, Thanks for your reply. So guest access to the course and activity needs to be available in order for the general public to be able to view the embedded copy of that H5P on our external (Joomla) website?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: I would assume so if access is unauthenticated (ie ungraded, untracked). If you were looking for LTI features of h5p.com, Moodle can be set up as a LTI provider and any module can be configured as an LTI offering. I do not know whether Joomla supports LTI, but I would not be surprised if it did.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: I had the same problem and found that there is a code library ( https://github.com/tunapanda/h5p-standalone ) for allowing h5p to run standalone. But you have to be coder to know how to use it. So I built a quick in-browser tool to package h5p's so they can work in a standalone way. It takes in the h5p package and gives you a zip file with all the standalone files included. Maybe it could help, rather than dealing with all the guest access requirements and linking to the correct pluginfile.php, etc. https://frumbert.github.io/h5p/index.html

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Hosting H5P on Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: And another alternate approach might be to put the content on your own H5P OER Hub https://h5p.org/oer-hub-coming and then share it out to both Moodle and Joomla. That's more of a commitment, but if you are deep into H5P as your key tool, that's a solid approach.

ResponsesInList.Title: Interactive Video - Submitting answers
ResponsesInList.Text: I get asked this one a lot for interactive videos: How come my answers aren't submitted after I answered them? This reveals to me that NOBODY knows that this little star at the end of the video is something you can click on. You don't normally have to click on anything on an interactive video in order to have it prompt you. For instance, while the video is playing interactions will appear for you - and you can click on them. But there is nothing indicating that you need to click in the bottom bar. The submit screen has the 'Submit Answers' button. But most people NEVER REALISE there is a button they must hunt around for then press in order for their work to be saved. Is there a way to make this button ACCESSIBLE or OBVIOUS, other than having to build an explainer screen that tells them to click the obscure button then click submit?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Interactive Video - Submitting answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim! People should not have to hunt for the button, because the author can (and proably should) set trigger points for the submit screen and one should be put at the end of the video automatically if I recall correctly. When those trigger points are reached, the video stops and presents the users with the submit screen. Best, Oliver

In order to see the change I had to delete the H5P from the course and add it again!! 1. Is this normal? 2. Does this mean I have "two" copies of the H5P on my course (one in the Content Bank and another in the course)? 3. What would be the best option/practice to optimize space and to easily update changes? Would highly appreciate feedback Emma

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P usage in a course
ResponsesInList.Text: Emma, This is explained in the documentation : "If you add the content as an alias, any modifications will be displayed here but if you add it as a copy, the modifed version will not display." So it depends on how you add the Package file to the activity whether or not the one in course remains connected to the one in the Content bank. It works in the same way many file repositories do.

ResponsesInList.Title: Upload file from repository (file System-FTP) to content bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Dears, To solve the issue of uploading big files, I opted for the file repository option that allow to upload files via FTP to a repository file in the server . The issue now is I cannot find a way to pick this files(uploaded in FTP server) into the Content bank to create an h5p video, as there are only two options to upload a file. is there a way how to display the content of the repository file as explained in the link: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/File_system_repository Kind Regards, Jaouad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload file from repository (file System-FTP) to content bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jaouad, The 'Upload a video button' is a H5P widget and not compatible with the Moodle file manager. So you will need another tool to accomplish this. One method would be to use the Lumi desktop tool to create a H5P content from a file on the desktop and then upload the H5P files via ftp to server file system. You would them be able to use the file system repository to add theme to the content bank. From the Content bank select Upload content and the File system repository will appear as an option in the file manager. Another option would be to use the latest version of Repurpose resources content type plugin to import files into a Column content. This allows adding audio , image and video files to the column type with the Moodle file picker. From there the Audio, Video, and Image objects can be copy and pasted into other types. Unfortunately it does not look like you can paste into Interactive Video so it would have to be modified if that is what you need. Daniel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upload file from repository (file System-FTP) to content bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot Daniel, I tried the first method it work perfectly. Kind Regards, Jaouad

ResponsesInList.Title: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: As a non-profit, Curriki has been working diligently over the last two years to develop a free and open, independent and embedable content authoring suite that leverages H5P, LTI and xAPI. Our goal is to make it easy to author, distribute and deliver active learning experiences. As a long-time fan of Moodle and H5P, we are at point where we are ready to start a much deeper integration to Moodle, especially by using LTI 1.3/Advantage. I would like to begin a discussion to evaluate the merits and shortcomings of this new suite within the context of the needs of both Moodle authors, as well as Moodle developers. A long-time fan and admirer, Leo Cunha CTO, Curriki.org

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: That seems to be an interesting option if you can host another server or pay for it. The LUMI app ( https://lumi.education/ ) can also be used for making and editing H5P modules. It is also free, open source, and you can download an app for PC, Mac or Linux and run it in your own device, without installing or paying for a server. Plus, it has a great multi-language support for the names and descriptions of all H5P modules.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Leonardo, I am not sure I understand the intent of your message above and am not sure what response you are wanting. This forum deals mostly with the two current implementations of H5P available in Moodle as well and using H5P as an LTI consumer. It mostly involves user problems with those methods. If you are providing a source for H5P materials, this may the right place. Developers that work on those implementations often respond in this forum to problems, but if you with details of setting up a new integration, there may be more developers interested in the General development forum or in LTI forum. It might also help to create a tracker issue if you want attention from the core development team. Moodle HQ is interested in Open Educational Resources as is Joubel and both are working at establishing content hubs. You may have luck contacting either of those directly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: CurrikiStudio as an option to publish H5P to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel, You are right, I may have misplaced the post My intent was exactly what you mention. On one side, as a provider of OER technology, it is exactly what you mention - to collaborate on a content hub, as well as to provide a tighter integration between the content hub and LTI/xAPI compliant LMSs. As a long-time user and integrator of Moodle, I am working on strategies that can also make it easier for (a) authors to build, sequence, and distribute H5P activities , (b) make it more seamless for learners to consume those experiences inside the LMS, and (c) leverage xAPI/Learning Record Store to standardize the collection of learning analytics across LMSs compliant with open standards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can't edit or create Course Presentation or Interactive Video types
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi There, We have a problem where the above content types are not working correctly on desktop across all browsers used (Chrome/ IE / Firefox ) We do not know at what point the bug started except that it was some time after 8th October 2019. The problem occurs using both H5P 1.20.1 and Moodle 3.5.9+ (PreProd) and H5P 1.17.2 and Moodle 3.5.7 (Prod) Now, very importantly, the problem does not occur on our Dev Server , using H5P 1.20.1 and Moodle 3.5.9+ What happens on our Production and Preprod servers is that: The H5P content appears to work correctly, including editing, right up until someone completes the activity and then the completion is reset. Sometimes a person only has to complete the activity. At this point, you attempt to edit it - instead of seeing the editable content, you get a piece of code like this: [field:group:coursepresentation:presentation] We discovered that we also cannot create new activities of the Course Presentation or Interactive Video types. Other content types do not appear to be affected. We have turned on debugging and replicated the issues but there are never any messages in regard to this problem. Dev, Preproduction and Production environments all underwent upgrades from Moodle 3.5.7 to 3.5.9 recently, however this has not caused issues on the Dev server. We do not control upgrades to the server environments or security configurations and though we have asked for details as to changes to these environments, we do not yet have this information. It seems that the server configuration (that we do not have access to) may be playing a part in this as we do not experience the same issues with the same software and courses on the Dev server. I have read around the internet and see that some people have experienced similar issues - does anyone have some advice for us that we can use to point our IT people in the right direction? Our H5P modules are great additions to our courses and we would like to continue using the software. Thank you for your time

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can't edit or create Course Presentation or Interactive Video types
ResponsesInList.Text: Did you manage to fix this? Someone here attempted to update the Course Presentation module and now we get this [field:group:coursepresentation:presentation] . thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can't edit or create Course Presentation or Interactive Video types
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi There, Yeah, we did manage to fix this eventually. It is something to do with old libraries getting stuck in the backend and not being updated properly. Sometimes you can fix it by editing the activity (if possible), or by completely uninstalling H5P and then reinstalling it (but take a copy of every single H5P activity before doing so as you lose them all if you don't). Another time we fixed it by doing an upgrade of Moodle and H5P. You can also manually download the correct library and that sometimes works. It's all a bit hit and miss. Kathy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: You are right, Beatriz. Teachers will have access by default to their courses' content bank to create and edit H5P content. You don't need anything else than a Moodle instance and the appropiate rights to access it If the 'Add' button in the content bank is disabled, might be because there's no H5P content type installed. A site administrator or manager could check the content types installed in Site admin / H5P / Manage H5P content types. They can either upload H5P content types from h5p.org or enable the scheduled task ' Download available H5P content types from h5p.org'. But you don't need any H5P account for it. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: The download of H5P activities is a Cron task, and part of the Moodle 'back end' that runs scheduled tasks automatically (just like sending out forums posts, or assignment notifications). So this is something for a site administrator to ensure is set correctly. There are a couple of H5P content types that do not appear to be added to Moodle including Impressive Presentation for example, I expect that has something to do with it being a Beta release. Your question about the Content Bank is also really important - and this should be clearly documented in Moodle Docs . Usually, if a file is added to a course as an Alias, and then the course is backed up and restored elsewhere, the alias files are not included. I assume it will be the same for this H5P Content Bank too, although I haven't had time to test it yet.
