ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ben, I think I faced the same problem as you describe. Here [1] I explained how all the content types are displayed in the Content Bank. Hope it helps. [1] https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=405882

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle is not maintaining H5P, just integrating H5P and Moodle projects. So the content types downloaded by default via the ' Download available H5P content types from h5p.org ' cron task are the ones H5P offers through their API. So this cron task will download all the content types in https://api.h5p.org/v1/content-types/ . We hope the number of content types H5P supports will increase in the future, and the cron task will download also the 'new' content types to your site. If you want to add a content type that is not listed by H5P API, you can upload it manually as Beatriz explained.

If some upgrades today, they may may have to wait thirty days they can user H5P unless they manually run the script. It seems like there should be a setting that prompts the admin whether the script should be run immediately when upgrading.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: The H5P content you put in your content bank in your course is available to others on the site who have editing or other mangement rights in your course and so can access the content bank via the file picker when you add an h5P activity. My understanding is that the content bank you see in your individual courses only relates to you in that course and you can't search there for H5P content from other courses.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: The main idea of the content bank is to create the content once, and use it as many times as you need. Where to create that content depends on your permissions and other users' permissions. As Mary said, when teacher Bob creates a content in Course A content bank, that content will be available in any course for any user who has the right permission to Course A. So you can create a content in Course A and all the teacher with permissions to Course A could use the content in all their courses. So, if somebody with site level access creates a content in the Site Content bank, that content will be available for all teachers in all courses. The alias/copy options in the filepicker feature has a different purpose. If you choose a content from the Content bank repository and select 'Create an alias/shortcut to the file', if someone edits the content in the content bank, the changes will be applied also in this instance (kind of synchronized). But if you select 'Make a copy of the file' this will be a copy of the source content, so the changes and edition on the source content bank content won't be applied on the current instance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Amaia, I have tested the way H5P content is copied in Moodle by the user from the 'Make a copy of the file' option and what is important to know is that the copy isn't saved in the Content Bank, it is saved in the Server files area. This is an important difference and is not idea and may not be the best place for storing copies...I would have thought that the copy would have been saved into the Content Bank of the course you are saving it into!! Often Admins turn off Server files, like they do at the Institute I work at for all sorts of security and file management reasons so it would be impossible to access the copy in this scenario. So I would suggest the best way to get a copy of the H5P would be to download it and then upload it into the Content Bank of the course you want to have it in. Cheers, Ben

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Benjamin! That issue was closed because was not a bug, but a misunderstanding of how to use the content bank. You're issue is a different problem, and will have a different solution. Here you are some more information about Moodle Tracker and how to create new issues: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Tracker_introduction In this case, I think the issue you'll be reporting could be an 'Improvement'. And the component 'Content bank'. And you don't need to be worried about the rest of the fields (add whatever you think fits better). Adding 'Content bank' as a component the team that is "taking care" of that component will triage it, checking all the fields are ok, filling whatever else is missing and asking for any other information we need. The most important thing for us is you to use a clear title and to add as many information as you can to the 'Description' field: what the issue is, some steps to reproduce or understand and test the problem, use cases why this change/improvement is important, and so on. If you prefer, you could add that 'Title' and 'Description' here and I could create the tracker issue on your behalf. Don't worry about that But you'll see using the tracker is easier that expected and less scary ;-P Thanks a lot for your help and support. Amaia

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rachit! You could download your content from h5p.com and upload to the Content bank, but for now there is no way to synchronize h5p.com and your Moodle site. That means that your changes on Moodle won't be applied on your h5p.com site, and your changes on h5p.com won't be applied on your Moodle site. If you want to keep using and editing all your content in h5p.com, you could embed it in your Moodle site using 'Display H5P' filter available since Moodle 3.8. For more information see https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Display_H5P_filter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content Bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rachit, Yes as Amaia said one way is to embed your content in your Moodle site which works but you lose tracking capabilities for grading and reporting. The other way is to just use H5P.com's LTI integration. This way your content created on H5P.com is brought in to your Moodle site and you can edit the content on either side: Moodle or H5P.com. As a bonus, you also get access to reporting data (student analytics) and grades are stored in Moodle too. See more about H5P.com's integrations https://h5p.org/node/287135

Question: is it possible to copy the Post quiz that appears in the blue H5P plugin, to appear in our site using the black H5P plugin? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: is it possible to copy an H5P activity into core H5P plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Four Buckets Design, I am a little confused by your question. I think the copy paste method you are trying to do might not be supported between the H5P Plugin and Core H5P integration. I haven't tried and can't because I don't use the H5P Plugin in Moodle. But just to clarify, the black H5P icon, in your case, represents an activity from the H5P Plugin whereas the blue H5P icon represents Moodle's core integration (Content Bank) of H5P. If you want to get your H5P quiz activity (Post-Assessment Quiz) with the blue icon as an activity into your H5P Plugin, you will have to download the H5P package from the Content Bank and then upload it into your course using the Plugin. For info on the use of H5P in Moodle, see post by Svein-Tore from Joubel - The H5P Moodle plugin vs H5P.com vs the new Moodle core integration and in a pinned discussed in this forum Should you use the H5P plugin, or H5P core functionality in Moodle? Hope that helps. Best regards, Ben

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: is it possible to copy an H5P activity into core H5P plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: Each implementation has its own clipboard so you can not copy and past between them. You can however transfer to the files from one implementation to the other then copy and paste the content.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: is it possible to copy an H5P activity into core H5P plugin?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! You can also use the migration tool for copying/moving content from third-party plugin (black icon) to Moodle core activity (blue): https://docs.moodle.org/en/H5P_migration_tool

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Translate H5P items
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for these useful links, Germ√°n! I would add that, compared to the excellent AMOS system, the translation process for the H5P contents is not at all user-friendly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Translate H5P items
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all! There's https://translate-h5p.tk/ that can be used for translating H5P content types if you are not familiar with how to use github. It prevents you from accidentally breaking the file structure, it allows you to keep translations consistent across all the content types, it allows you to get notified if translations get changed or added, ... Just keep in mind that each language needs a dedicated editor who needs to check language translations from time to time to prevent misuse and to press a button to sync that language's translations on translate-h5p.tk to the official repositories - you can apply to become such an editor. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Translate H5P items
ResponsesInList.Text: You're right, Oliver. That site is more or less the equivalent of Moodle's AMOS translation system. I have occasionally used it and found it rather user-friendly. There are, however, 2 main points on which AMOS is superior: - for each language used in Moodle there is a translation "supervisor" who is responsible for checking the validity of the translations submitted by volunteer translators, especially checking the consistency of the terms used; - when the submitted translations have been validated, the language pack is immediately updated and made available to Moodle users. Unfortunately this is not the case with H5P where one has to wait (sometimes for a very long time) for a new version of the H5P content to be released along-with the new translations.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Translate H5P items
ResponsesInList.Text: I was not suggesting that https://translate-h5p.tk/ platform is the ultimate solution. If you re-read my post, however, you will notice that I mentioned it for content types which was the original posters topic (not the H5P plugin for moodle ) and the editor role that I mentioned is what you call "supervisor". Also it is available now . Sebastian Rettig just took the initiative to set it up for content types and aligned it with the H5P core team's workflow. I don't say it's a perfect solution - and you could move all of H5P to use AMOS, the WordPress translation system or whatever yields more benefits - but that's something that should be discussed where the H5P core team actually has a chance to find the discussion, shouldn't it? After all, moodle is just one of many platforms that H5P runs on.

Can I manually load these translated strings without updating Moodle?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Translate H5P items
ResponsesInList.Text: The translations that someone contributes as a "pull request" to the H5P GitHub site will usually take little time (a few days) to be accepted (or corrected/rejected) by the H5P code maintainers. They have been very friendly to me as a new GitHub translator (for 'es' and 'es-mx' languages) who has made quite a few beginner's mistakes. But these translated strings will only show up to the Moodle H5P users after H5P.org decides to change the H5P downloadable code for a particular module, and that may take several weeks or even months for some cases. But it is worth doing. One year ago the Spanish languages ('es' and 'es-mx') had less than half their H5P strings translated, and now we have +98% translated strings!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Translate H5P items
ResponsesInList.Text: If you really want to quickly translate ONLY your local strings of an H5P plugin in a Moodle server , I think that you can do it the quick and dirty way: 1) Install the desired H5P module in Moodle. 2) Use it a little. 3) Use the Notepad++ Windows program in order to find and replace the English language strings that you want translated inside the files in your Moodle server. 4) Restart your Moodle server 5) Write us to comment whether it worked. 6) Beware that your surgically translated strings will be replaced whenever the H5P code for the particular module is updated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Er: Re: Moodle 3.9 H5P problem
ResponsesInList.Text: We had been experiencing this as well. After spending many hours trying to find the cause and a fix, this is what we found. The language files (en.js, etc) in the H5P library (h5p/h5plib/v124/joubel/editor/language/) got converted to Windows format by our git client. The code to parse the H5P language file expects Unix file formats and was, therefore, not able to correctly parse the language strings. Replacing the files in h5p/h5plib/v124/joubel/editor/language/ and rebuilding cache fixed the issue. See https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-71343 for more details. Hope this helps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Er: Re: Moodle 3.9 H5P problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you! I'll have a look and really hope this will be it!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P activity doesn't fit in page....
ResponsesInList.Text: The content is adjusted to fit your screen/window size. The user on a desktop can change size of the content by reducing the width of the window. Content should be designed to display on a device with a reason aspect ratio. In your example the image is 500 by 229 which is unusually wide. The aspect ratio of the Dialog card also depends on the content. Placing a tall picture a card or long text is going to make it so users have to scroll.

ResponsesInList.Title: Embedding H5P - changing width and height of video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok last question I think. Is there anyway to be able to change the width and height of a H5P created video from the content bank or as it is being created? Thanks for all your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Embedding H5P - changing width and height of video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nick, Unfortunately I don't know how to change the width and height of a video. I've split your post from the original discussion for hopefully someone else to answer.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Embedding H5P - changing width and height of video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Because H5P content is HTML5 it will always fill the maximum space / correct ratio. That's so the responsive nature will 'fit' the actual display (not use absolute sizing). Without using some (fairly advanced) HTML code you can't alter the size, and in 99% of cases if you did it would cause problems on different screen sizes that you didn't anticipate.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Embedding H5P - changing width and height of video?
ResponsesInList.Text: Video can be embedded in H5P course presentation and the the dimension set there relative to the size of the total course presentation. This however may make it appear to small on some devices. If you are embedding content with the H5P filter you can embed the link with a HTML container and set the max-width on the container on better use bootstrap col classes to choose with based on available screen resolution. For activities this coudl be done by overriding a template in the theme. Generally though I think the idea of responsive design is for users to control the sizing by changing their window size.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! If you could create a new Accordion but not a Multiple choice content type, the issue could be related to installed libraries (just a guess, but I think it worth a try). Then you could go back to Content bank and give it another try to create content. If that doesn't work, would be great to check error logs and see if we can get some more information about the issue. About disabling core H5P activity shouldn't help, because the content bank should be independent to the activity itself. The activity could 'use' content in the Content bank, but the Content bank doesn't 'use' the activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: cannot create H5P content in Moodle 3.10, Boost theme
ResponsesInList.Text: There are quite a few differences between core H5P plugin (the blue one) and the third party H5P plugin (the black one). I would say one of the main differences is the way the work and how they manage the content itself. For the "black" H5P activity, the content is created/edited inside the activity. The content created is completely managed by the activity itself. Content and activity are totally dependent. For the "blue" H5P activity it's not as dependent to the content itself. The content is created, edited and managed by the Content bank. And you can USE it (from the Content bank) in a (blue) H5P activity. Or in a dozen of activities, or in an atto editor text, or... Apart from that, there are some features already implemented in (black) H5P activity that are not implemented yet in (blue) core H5P activity or Content bank. So they are not exactly the same. But about how the H5P editor works, and the issue you are having, should work mostly the same (technically speaking), because the Content bank is using the API offered by H5P. I hope this helps to understand the differences/advantages/disadvantages for each of them

ResponsesInList.Text: "I uninstalled H5P from CONTENT BANK and it is empty." How did you manage to do that?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P is invisible in CONTEN BANK
ResponsesInList.Text: As admin you could go to Site administration > Plugins > Plugins overview and see the full list of plugins installed and uninstall them. I hardly recommend not to do it; or do it ONLY when you are VERY sure that you won't need that plugin. Disabling it is less risky.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P is invisible in CONTEN BANK
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rovshan! The Content bank is a "place" where to manage content in Moodle. You could install Content bank plugins to manage different type of contents. By default, H5P plugin is installed in Moodle to mange H5P content. I mean, the responsible to manage and support H5P content is the H5P plugin. So, if you uninstall it, your Content bank won't be able to Manage any H5P content. So you couldn't upload or create any H5P content in the Content bank. This would happened with any plugin in Moodle. If you, for example, uninstall 'Forum' activity, you won't be able to see or create any Forum activity. I hope this makes sense.

ResponsesInList.Title: Content scripting
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone! I am relatively new to using moodle, but have worked with different systems for learning and content management in the past. When developing new online courses, I was used to writing a script for the content in a separate word-file with specific templates. Basically a¬† fill-out form that made it a lot easier to review the text and content your e-learning module before you start uploading it into the learning platform. Something like the following: Format: Multiple Choice Question Question title (max 30 characters): How are you doing today? Question information (max 200 characters): Click the word below that best describes how you're feeling today. Option 1: Great! Option 2: Medium Option 3: Terrible Option 4: Other Correct answer(s): 1, 2, 3, 4. Feedback correct: Thanks for sharing that with us! Any help is greatly appreciated! We use Moodle 3.9 at the moment.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P not working on the Moodle mobile app 3.8
ResponsesInList.Text: To clarify Helen's reply, Licia, to get this working, you would need to have the latest version of the Moodle App, and you would need your Moodle site to be running 3.8. Updating the Moodle App on a smartphone is easy, but upgrading your site from Moodle 3.3 to 3.8 is obviously a more major operation, and will likely involve your IT department scheduling, testing, and actioning a site upgrade.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P not working on the Moodle mobile app 3.8
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Licia, Sorry for the late reply. I saw your post yesterday and thought of replying. I hope you have achieved the desired output i.e. accessing H5P content created using H5P Activity on the mobile app. In case you are yet to, here is the solution. Prerequisites: Moodle mobile app version - 3.8 Step 1: Enable web services in moodle at Administration->Advanced features->enable web services Step 2: Enable frame embedding at Administration->Security->HTTP Security->allow frame embedding Step 3: Comment X-Frame-Options in your "httpd.conf file ". Follow this procedure to do that. Open your httpd.conf file which can be found in your apache folder at "/apache2/conf/httpd.conf". On my Bitnami installation, it is available at "/opt/bitnami/apache2/conf/httpd.conf". Based on your installation it can be found in the apache2 folder. Open the file using Vim. Find ( approx. line no. 528) and comment the line " header always setifempty X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN ". Do not alter any other lines. Step 4: Restart the apache server . Now you should be able to access any H5P content created using the H5P activity.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P not working on the Moodle mobile app 3.8
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I am having similar problems: H5P content is not displayed on Moodle mobile app (mobile app 3.9.1 on android, Moodle 3.8.3 Build: 20200511). Thank you, Subhash, for your hint how to fix the problem by commenting out the "header always setifempty X-Frame-Options SAMEORIGIN" in the httpd.conf file of the http server. However, this seems to add a security risk to the http server called "Clickjacking attacks" (cref https://geekflare.com/secure-apache-from-clickjacking-with-x-frame-options/ ). - How risky is that? Do all sites that run H5P on Moodle 3.8 and use the mobile app have to do this? Or are there other solutions to that? Looking forward to your responses, Burkhard

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P not working on the Moodle mobile app 3.8
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm using the latest version of Moodle and Mobile Moodle as of this writing and had the same issue.¬†Subhash fix still work and fix the same problem. For me I'm testing right now so I don't care and I'm not running https right now either. But thank you Burkhard for pointing out the clickjacking attacts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Missing "upgrade library" icon/link/feature in Moodle h5pactivity
ResponsesInList.Text: I've just upgraded my H5P "Dialog Cards Papi Jo" version from 1.2.0 to 1.3.0 and I'm surprised that there is no icon/link/feature in Moodle (core) h5pactivity mod similar to the one that exists in the hvp plugin . On the other hand, h5pactivity features a convenient "Delete version" trash/bin icon, which the hvp plugin did not. In the best of the worlds I¬† would like to have both features available to both modules! These 2 screen captures speak for themselves. --------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------- Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "upgrade library" icon/link/feature in Moodle h5pactivity
ResponsesInList.Text: hi Joseph, The H5P core updates the contentypes automatically while running a cron task. See: https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/H5P#Manage_H5P_content_types Gemma

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "upgrade library" icon/link/feature in Moodle h5pactivity
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks, Gemma, but I think you misunderstood my problem. My problem is not with updating the H5P content types libraries. My problem is: when a new version of a library is available on a moodle site where H5P instances were created with an older version, the hvp plugin provides a way to upgrade those older instances to use the new library version . This very useful feature is missing from the Moodle (core) h5pactivity, as clearly shown on my 2 screenshots. Note.- This seems related to MDL-68922 ( H5P doesn't upgrade content when there is a newer H5P library ). But the tracker reports this bug as fixed and closed. Maybe the "automatic" upgrading of contents only works for the "official" H5P activities , not for non-official ones, such as my own. I will investigate further and report in this thread.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "upgrade library" icon/link/feature in Moodle h5pactivity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joseph! Thanks for raising this issue. As Gemma mentioned, the behaviour for the H5P core libraries is slightly different and that's why this feature hasn't been included until now: H5P player uses the version defined in the H5P package file. H5P editor uses ALWAYS the latest version available in the system. So, for instance, if you have installed 2 different versions of your "Dialog Cards Papi Jo" library (1.12.0 and 1.13.0) and upload an H5P content to the Content bank with the "Dialog Cards Papi Jo" v1.12.0, it will be displayed with the libraries included in 1.12.0. However, if you edit this content (using the H5P editor included in the Content bank editor) and save, it will be automatically upgraded to the latest (v1.13.0) so, from now, it will be always displayed with this library version. If you feel some extra feature should be added to let admins to bulk this action will all the existing contents for an existing content type, feel free to create an issue in the tracker Kind regards! Sara

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "upgrade library" icon/link/feature in Moodle h5pactivity
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sara, Thanks for your answer, which works perfectly. It's OK if one only has a handful of contents to upgrade, but a bulk upgrade would be nice to have, of course! I will create an "new feature" issue for this. Also, when all contents have been upgraded to the most current library version, it would be nice to be able to delete the now obsolete library from the Moodle interface. Best, Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing "upgrade library" icon/link/feature in Moodle h5pactivity
ResponsesInList.Text: Created MDL-70918

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P message about tracking
ResponsesInList.Text: Ise, You can change this into Portuguese in the Language customisation area. In Site administration > Language > Languages customisation, open the Portuguese language pack for editing. In the "Show strings of these components" list, select "h5pactivity.php", and for the string identifier, enter in "previewmode" and click the Show strings button. You will then see box with an area for local customisation. Enter your translation into the box and save this. Please see the attached screenshot, which is an example of how this looks in the Spanish language pack, which already has a translation for this string. Long term, you should also contact the maintainer of the Portuguese pack with your translation and ask them to add it to the pack so everyone will get the update. You can find out about that at AMOS , the Moodle translation site .

ResponsesInList.Title: A few security queries....
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, I'm looking at upgrading to M3.9 (from 3.5) and taking advantage of the integrated H5P activity. I've read what information I can find, but I'm looking for a bit more about how the plugin works and interacts with the H5P website and it's content. So my questions are: Does the H5P activity interact with content/sites outside of the Moodle installation? - Is any data sent offsite, or is it completely isolated? I read that the H5P catalogue is updated via cron task. Is this true? - Can it be turned off or manually checked before allowing any additions or updates? Can some of the H5P content types be restricted, or is it an all or nothing catalogue? I would likely want to restrict certain users to the H5P activity, and then certain H5P resources within the catalogue. I wouldn't want users adding to the catalogue at this stage. Many thanks in advance & apologies if I've overlooked something. Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A few security queries....
ResponsesInList.Text: 1) Yes. By default the new core integrated H5P is set to download updated and new content types and libraries from the H5P Hub server via a Scheduled task. 2) Yes. This is controlled by the Scheduled Task "Download available H5P content types from h5p.org" (\core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task). This is on by default and runs once a month. If you prefer to control the content types and libraries yourself, then turn this scheduled task off, and use the "Manage H5P content types" in Site admin > H5P instead to manually upload the content type files and library files you need. 3) It is all or nothing. There is no option in the Moodle integrated activity to hide or disable a specific content type nor are there specific permissions for the content types. You either have them installed or not: If they are installed, then anyone who can add the H5P activity (by default, Teachers) can use all the content types. (N.B. This is different from the standard H5P "Interactive Content" plugin which does have the ability to restrict content types.) 4) "restrict certain users to the H5P activity" - You can do this in the roles by setting the various permissions for the activity as a whole, just as for other activities . Search for mod/h5pactivity in the Roles to see the details. There are four main capabilities: view, submit (for Students), and add and review submissions (for Teachers). 5) "certain H5P resources within the catalogue" - Only Admins and Managers have the ability to manage the content types. By default, the Manager role can see and use the tool in Site admin > H5P > Manage H5P content types , which is controlled by the capability "Manage H5P content types" (moodle/h5p:updatelibraries), set to Allow for Manager. This is all or nothing, too: there is no way to set it up so that some Managers, for instance, can manage some content types but not other content types. This permissions means they can add or remove any or all of them. Hope this is helpful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A few security queries....
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy, this is a great reply and most useful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A few security queries....
ResponsesInList.Text: Anthony, Most welcome, that was a great question and I'm glad I'm not the only one thinking about those data protection issues with H5P. I thought about your question of how Moodle and the H5P Hub talk, but I don't know exactly what data is exchanged during an update with the H5P Hub. It could be done in several ways, but certainly the Hub would know your Moodle address, IP address and approximate location, etc. I would assume, for the sake of efficiency, it would exchange what content types and version you have installed for update. (Although Moodle could just say, "Send me all the latest versions" and handle the matching locally, which would be less efficient but more privacy preserving.) A further question is does this update process cross the line into telemetry or usage statistics other than that required for updates? Eg. does it send the number of installed content types in use? Hopefully, someone who does know the details of that can chime in here. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A few security queries....
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anthony and Randy! Thanks for raising and answering these interesting topics! Regarding the information that is sent from Moodle to update the content types, what Moodle is currently doing (only if the "Download available H5P content types from h5p.org (\core\task\h5p_get_content_types_task)" task is enabled), is the last one Randy mentioned: is calling the H5P endpoint hub using a site unique identifier that, by default, is a hash of the URL defined in $CFG-> wwwroot , and then, the content-types are processed one by one (to check if they have to be upgraded or not). For technical people (if you're curious), this is where this call is done: https://github.com/moodle/moodle/blob/master/h5p/classes/core.php#L305 So no privacy data is sent to the H5P hub to get the latest content types. This task can be disabled but then admins will need to upload and upgrade manually the content types, as Randy said I hope this helps! Kind regards!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A few security queries....
ResponsesInList.Text: Sara, Thank you! I knew you would know the answer This iooks nicely designed from a privacy perspective. I do hope that there are plans to add the H5P plugin method of handling the version updates to the core H5P tool as well. The admin interface for that is very useful. To be able to choose which versions to update to and which content types to update is very valuable., especially for large sites with many thousands of activities of different types. This will be especially important for sites that remain on a maintenance release for a year or two, or for organizations with multiple instances, etc. where version dependencies will need testing before updating. Randy

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Yao w! I've downloaded your H5P Interactive Book activity and uploaded it to my local Drupal test site. There are actually 2 problems with your activity. 1.- If you want the student to find all the "o"s on your image, then you should use the "Find Multiple Hotspots" H5P activity, not the "Find the Hotspot"activity, which as it name implies is suitable for finding just ONE hotspot! All this is a bit confusing. 2.- Unfortunately, currently the "Find Multiple Hotspots" H5P activity is not available within the H5P Interactive Book activity. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Incompleted summary for Find the Hotspot in H5p
ResponsesInList.Text: Not solving the issue, but adding some insight: Find Multiple Hotspots was created by an Australian who meanwhile has abandoned the content type. That's unfortunate, because it has many shortcomings (technically not fit to be put into other content types, not localizable, not accessible) and that's why it is not included in Interactive Book. The H5P core team meanwhile has forked the original version of Find Multiple Hotspots and is going to merge the functionality of both content types into one, thus reducing the confusion.

Instead of having one icon per sub-content type, there should be just one button that will use the H5P Hub to choose. ( https://h5p.org/moodle-plugin-vs-moodle-core-vs-h5p-com ). ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Interactive Video - How to make the video appear rather than a link
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Is it possible to create an interactive video using H5P and have it appear as a thumbnail of the video within the course, ready to be played rather than the interactive video appearing as a link (as shown in the image below, which needs to be clicked to open the video). I've tried playing with every setting I can find but it always seems to appear only as a link. Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Interactive Video - How to make the video appear rather than a link
ResponsesInList.Text: H5P is an activity, so it displays like any other activity in Moodle - with a link on the course page to the activity. From your post I'm assuming you want some "YouTube like" image? But remember, an H5P Interactive Video is not just a movie clip like an mpg or avi, it's completely different. I can think of two ways to get somewhere where you want: a) Create a small image of the video, add this to a Label, and link it to the activity (which you can set as 'Hidden but available') b) Embed a link to the activity in a Label. However the ability to embed might be disabled on your site for security reasons, and if you can embed then you might struggle to get the size of object right. I would't take this route, as you might end up with several embedded activities on the course home page which could slow it down dramatically. My advice would be to stick to the way it works, which is consistent with other activities and resources on the course page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Interactive Video - How to make the video appear rather than a link

In the course I'm setting up the H5P interactive video appears below a few vimeo videos so I was hoping that it would appear just like those ones, ready for users to hit play, rather than clicking a link which is not as noticeable as the previous videos and so could easily be missed. I just tried option (a) and it's closer to what I had in mind but am quite new to Moodle so will try option (b) once I've figured out how to use Labels and see how much it slows things down.

ResponsesInList.Title: Impossible to upgrade H5P library due to request body > 1MB
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello dear community! I want to upgrade all H5P libraries. It worked for all except Question Set (1.12.2). There are around 200 instances using it. I find the following JS issue in the browser‚Äôs console : Error 413 Request Entity Too Large ‚ÄúRequest Entity Too Large error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.‚Äù The process gets stuck at 18% when it encounters this error on a post request with a body of more than 1MB . Here is the endpoint concerned: https://‚Ä¶/mod/hvp/ ajax .php?action= libraryupgradeprogress &library_id=70 I‚Äôve checked the following php values to see if I could fix it simply. But they seem correct. post_max_size = upload_max_filesize = 512M max_execution_time = max_input_time > 180 The parameter impacting the accepted request body size is in Apache . Upon inquiry, it seems that the Apache ‚Äôs parameter to modify is LimitRequestBody so that it is not as limited. Unfortunately its modification (LimitRequestBody 0 in .htaccess) is not taken into account on a shared hosting . Would you have other ways to fix that? It would happen again next time I want to upgrade to a newer version. Bonus question: How can I know the list of activities using this library? Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Impossible to upgrade H5P library due to request body > 1MB
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! Is this the right place to ask that question? If not, could you advise somewhere else? Thanks!! Patrice

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Impossible to upgrade H5P library due to request body > 1MB
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, that looks like a server issue eh? I'd be looking at that max_execution_time - not unusual to see 300, or even 600. But if you are on shared hosting and can't change this, that's not ideal.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Impossible to upgrade H5P library due to request body > 1MB
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your answer. The php values (max_execution_time, ...) are way above that. The problem is the Apache parameter that I cannot change. Do you know if I can do the upgrade by batch (by hacking something in the JS?)? Or any other idea?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Impossible to upgrade H5P library due to request body > 1MB
ResponsesInList.Text: The issue if the file size though isn't it? Apache won't allow an upload by web more than a certain size. In this case, I suppose the possible workaround would be to setup a File Repository in Moodle, and if you have FT{P access you can transfer those files to file system, and then access them from there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Impossible to upgrade H5P library due to request body > 1MB
ResponsesInList.Text: I am not an expert when it comes to server -side issues, but I think overriding LimitRequestBody in a .htaccess to set a larger value file would undermine the admin's intention of limiting the value - and that's probably why it's not working. H5P's upgrade process is in fact running in batches already, creating requests for every single content instance. It fetches and posts a content type's parameters which in your case seem to be quite large (but a Question Set can become large, I guess). I don't think there's a way to shrink it down. Unfortunately, no solution that comes to my mind is really handy. The simplest one of them is probably to export the content, upgrade it on some other H5P platform and then re-placing the old versions be uploading the new ones - although that's still awkward depending on the number of content instances. If you prefer a programmatic approach, you'd have to take the parameters (filtered_parameters) from the content's database entry, upgrade them using the upgrade script that comes with Question Set ( https://github.com/h5p/h5p-question-set/blob/master/upgrades.js ) locally and then replace the old parameters and update the pointer id that links the content data to the library (from the old Question Set version to the new version).

ResponsesInList.Title: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe that until recently it was recommended not to use H5P for high-risk assessment because the answer key was sent to the browser along with the question and a user with¬† some computer skills would be able to cheat by reading the answer key. In the current 3.9 core version of H5P has this problem been dealt with? i.e. Is the answer key held back on the server ? I carried out a quick check with an H5P multiple choice question and I couldn't find the answer key in the page code, but maybe I did not go deep enough. Any thoughts? Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: This is not really something that the implementation can change with implementation. The content is usually embedded in an iframe. Right click to show 'This frame only', then search for jsonContent on the page source for to find the question source.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using H5P for high-risk assessment
ResponsesInList.Text: Its fundamental to the design difference between H5P and the Moodle Quiz. H5P is mainly in the browser and the Moodle Quiz never reveals the answer until it is ready. You have to be keen and determined to find the data in H5P, but if it is high stakes, someone will and once one person has you should assume everyone has.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: If you are using Moodle 3.8, then H5P is available in core. I'm not sure why you are also adding the H5P plugin? Whatever you do: "HTML view and other options on the Moodle WYSIWYG" and "not being visible on the H5P text editor" The editor in Moodle (Atto) and the editor within H5P are different.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply 'If you are using Moodle 3.8, then H5P is available in core. I'm not sure why you are also adding the H5P plugin?' - I want to create the H5P content like column structure including a quiz and all in the Moodle, not just to embed them. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: I think you still do not understand. 1. You said "I want to create the H5P content ... all in the Moodle, not just to embed them. So the H5P plugin is installed." OK, so you could upgrade to Moodle 3.9, and then H5P is in core, no need for a plugin: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/H5P But let's assume you cannot do this, and still using Moodle 3.8. 2. "I found out that the default H5P editor has hidden some features by default which mentioned above." If you think some H5P features are hidden, and you are using the H5P plugin, then your question should be to the H5P developers.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all! I think what Siddharth is trying to say (Siddharth, please correct me if I am wrong): The Atto editor has a way larger number of features (buttons) than the CKEditor that H5P uses. Both resemble each other visually, so I assume Siddharth was under the impression that some setting in moodle might allow to use other features in H5P. Siddarth also wrote a post on the H5P forum already where he went into more detail and where I already answered that not offering all the options in all the HTML widgets is not a technical problem, but it was a deliberate choice by the content type developers in order to keep the interface simpler. What I did not mention there, but what I am adding here now: Siddharth, if you're lacking a button from the CKEditor: You can use the H5P plugin's alter_semantics hook to add those that are used thoughout H5P, and you can even use the alter_scripts hook to add extra plugins to the CKEditor. Please visit the developer documentation on that topic . Please mind however, that your content will not run on other people's H5P instances unless they have made the same customizations. H5P will filter out HTML tags that are not allowed to be used in a content type. Cheers, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: Awesome post - thanks for detailing the possible options here Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Oliver!! That was very kind of you for such a reply! I have been studying that developer documentation related to alter_sementics for a long time, but could not find the files in which I should make the changes. I just keep getting lost in finding the file located inside the Moodle module directory of H5P for making change in the CKEditor buttons. I got till this page, but could not understand should I make the changes in the same page - mod/hvp/renderers.php and if yes then what would be the code for enabling the HTML code for that one? Here someone has applied the¬† MathJax by applying some changes. But it is tough to find it for Moodle. Challange I am facing: I am using the tables used in the H5P, but they are not giving good output and also have bugs. So I am having the styling already created. I just need to give ID to the respective tables. I also have some HTML contents in which I need to give ID to DIVs, but also not seem possible without it. I need to use SVG in place of PNG, which are not supported in the H5P default as well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Text Editor - using HTML code
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Siddharth! You're halfway there, but the first step would be to use the alter_semantics hook . You'd use the $name variable to determine for what library H5P is about to render the editor (in $major_version and $minor_version ).¬†The $semantics variable will contain the complete editor structure that you can parse for the text elements that you'd like to alter - and when you have found them, you simple amend its tag property with the values that you want and are allowed to use . It's not specific to moodle, but works the same way on WordPress and Drupal. All the best for finding solutions to your challenges! I don't know what the chances are, but I created the code to solve the SVG one just yesterday and filed in a pull-request . Cheers, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello. I have a teacher who created an activity and selected that each "text" of the drag and drop be left- aligned. When in editing mode of the activity, we can see the "left-aligned" being applied. However, when viewing the activity, it reverts back to text-justified: center. I tried to override this with custom css , which works in by browser tools, but it does not work when I save it to my theme's custom CSS section. This is the activity type I am referring to: https://h5p.org/drag-and-drop This is the css I have tried so far: .h5p-dragquestion .h5p-draggable {text-align: left!important;} div.h5p-draggable.ui-draggable.h5p-advanced-text {text-align: left!important;} This is what I see before and after i edit the justification in the browser tools:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John, This is a known bug in H5P¬†Drag & Drop. I reported it more than 2 years ago here: https://h5p.org/node/195548 with an easy fix... but it was never fixed by the H5P core team.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Not to break existing content is the "not so easy" part. Don't think there has been a proposal for that in text or code yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: See https://h5ptechnology.atlassian.net/browse/HFP-1884

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't see the problem of breaking existing content being addressed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Joseph, I added the two pull requests https://github.com/h5p/h5p-editor-drag-question/pull/29 and https://github.com/h5p/h5p-drag-question/pull/82 Let's see what happens. Best, Luca

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luca! Probably nothing, as this change would break existing content. You don't know whether people wanted their content to be centered or if the were forced to by the bug. Now removing that property would allow to change the positioning, but all existing content would automatically use left alignment unless you add an upgrade script introduction some extra flag for each draggable existing content and some extra code to handle "old" and "new" differently in the view and also some extra code to remove the flag on a draggable once the alignment is activately changed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Oliver, I beg to disagree with your reply above. 1.- There is definitely a bug in the D. & D. activity, which can be easily fixed by that small change: in the D. & D. library css file for the .h5p-dragquestion .h5p-draggable elements, remove the text-align: center rule. And removing that rule will not break existing D. & D. activity instances as I'm hoping to demonstrate. 2.- When entering the text editor in H5P activities text is left-aligned by default (the Align Left button is selected by default). Users who want their text to be either centered or right-aligned need to click the relevant buttons on the toolbar. Unfortunately, because of the bug mentioned above, the text-align: center rule over-rides the align-left default behaviour of text. On the figure below, I have attached to a D. & D. display the extract from the content.json file for each draggable item. As we can see, the draggable text which says "left-aligned (default) text" does not have a style rule, it's not needed because left alignment is the default behaviour. I have created 3 text draggables, and, as per the bug, the text which says "left-aligned (default) text" is displayed as centered. 3.- Now let's see what happens after simply removing the text-align: center rule from the D. & D. library css file for the .h5p-dragquestion .h5p-draggable elements. The draggable text which the user had originally selected to be centered is still centered , ditto with the right-aligned text, and the default left-aligned text is indeed correctly displayed as left-aligned. Everybody is happy. What you wrote "... removing that property would allow to change the positioning, but all existing content would automatically use left alignment " is not true. Actually, two categories of users might be unhappy---or, rather, intrigued---after the fix. a) those users who initially wanted their text left-aligned, saw it centered because of the bug, had resigned themselves to the buggy behaviour and now, after the fix, saw things displayed as they originally wished; b) those users who did want their text centered, and at first clicked the Center toolbar button, then one day realized that this was not necessary since leaving the Align Left default button clicked gave the same result. It's impossible to know if those are in the majority. I am of opinion that it does not matter, as they can always edit their D. & D. and center their text if they wish to do so. And this minor inconvenience is balanced by the major advantage of making things work as they should. Q.O.D.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: What you wrote "... removing that property would allow to change the positioning, but all existing content would automatically use left alignment" is not true. You are correct, this one was not true or not precise or incomplete at least. Let me try to explain better this time. When people have designed content, they were not able to make text be left-aligned. We can agree on that, I believe. We also agree that this is a bug, I assume. Now, people may have wanted the text to be centered, but they never ever explicitly clicked on the center button. Why would they, as it's way more convenient to just enter the text, it's centered, done. At least I am that lazy, but I dare to assume that many people also never explicitly set the text to be centered. See where I am heading? Now, removing that property would allow to change the positioning [to left-aligned], but all existing content [that never explicitly set the text to be centered] would automatically use left alignment. That's your scenario b) and we can argue all day long how many content types would be effected - we don't know. But it's not just matter of "technical" right or wrong, but people are involved. I for myself as a user would be pretty pissed if I had to manually edit every single Draggable in Drag-and-Drop. I as a company would not want to deal with pissed-off people, so I better implement a fix that doesn't cause that trouble. It's always simple to argue "this is technically wrong, and there's this easy fix!" from a developer perspective, but then you neglect that you are dealing with humans who are using your software. As I outlined above, it's possible to fix that, but it involves more that just removing the CSS property. I'd appreciate if you could at least agree that "easy fixable" may be true from a technical perspective, but not from a socio-technical perspective. If you on top of that stopped repeating and insinuating that this was an easy fix:¬†üòò Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for your reply, Oliver. I think we can say that "we agree to disagree".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Agreed!¬†üòÅ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: I think the disagreement is one of policy. The Moodle integration policy is that bugs should whenever possible be backported to all versions released in the last year. Security bugs are backported for another year or longer for LTS. So Moodle developers and admins expect this. If you submit a core fix for Moodle integration that policy is not debatable. The policy is not necessarily shared by other user communities. H5P is used on other platforms, and H5P core team detemine their own policy. If one is submitting a patch for an H5P core content type, one should follow their rules.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Oliver, Since the bug does not occur when creating/editing and H5P (it only happens when viewing the saved H5P), I don't think (imo) there is confusion regarding what people originally wanted since when people design it, they either immediately see Left as the default, or they would have changed it to Center and could definitely see this change immediately in action on the 'edit' screen. The issue is more likely "have people gotten used to seeing it centered on the 'view' screen despite how they originally designed it." Does that make sense to you? Again, imo!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Drag & Drop - Centers text despite "Left" being selected
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John! The recommended steps are to a) create the dropzones and then b) create the draggables, because you need to tell them what drop zone they can be dropped onto. When you follow these steps even without setting centered alignment on the text, in the editor you will immediately see the text centered in the draggable. Once you're used to that behavior, I believe it's very unlikely that you always explicitly click on the center button when you create text draggables. I don't (sample size = 1). Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Resume interactive video on login
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a H5P specific question. So it should be asked on the H5P community: https://h5p.org/forum As far as I know, the H5P Interactive Video does not have a 'resume' function.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Resume interactive video on login
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! This is possible if you activate the "save content state" option in the settings of the H5P plugin. If users are logged in, many H5P content types (including Interactive Video) will then store the current state in a regular time interval that you can set as well and whenever a task is checked. There's also a pull request for optionally adding that feature for users who are not logged in, but it will probably take some time until that one is added. This question becomes moodle related if you are not using the H5P plugin but the H5P integration into moodle core of moodle 3.8+. To the best of my knowledge, the moodle core version does not feature the "save content state" option. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Resume interactive video on login
ResponsesInList.Text: Oliver is right. Unfortunately the very useful "Save content state" is not (yet?) available in the H5P integration into Moodle core version. I mentioned this issue in this post . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Dialog Card could not be saved?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chrissy! Saving the content state is deactivated by default. If you are using the H5P plugin for moodle, on the H5P settings page you/your admin will have to activate the "Save content state" option (mod_hvp | enable_save_content_state). Be aware though that this will activate that feature for all content types. If you are using the core version of H5P in moodle, then I am not sure - that feature may not have been implemented yet. Best, Oliver

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Dialog Card could not be saved?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to uninstall or downgrade H5P without lost the data
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't think you can downgrade H5P? When you upgrade a plugin it changes things in it's database tables, so going backwards isn't a good idea, or even possible often. However, the change from H5P 1.17 to 1.20 must be relatively small, so this might not be your issue. Because Themes don't affect the Moodle tables (Themes just style what is there) it should be possible to remove the Theme, and use an earlier version of that without any major issue. I would check what happens with the current H5P 1.20 with a standard Model Theme like Boost first, to see if you still have that error.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tehila, How about using the H5P migration tool to migrate content from mod_hvp to the H5P activity in 3.9? Please let us know how you get on!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P issue adding images in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: We'll give this a go. Will report back.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P issue adding images in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: A quick update on where we are. We're finding that this occurs on courses if there is existing H5P objects made via the plugin. On new courses or existing courses with no older H5P object, its fine. Also, if you have objects and delete them. In a matter of hours it will also start working.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P issue adding images in Moodle 3.9

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P issue adding images in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: That message is probably because you are viewing as a Teacher? Of course no Grades are recorded in Moodle if you have a Teacher Role. To test this, you need to Login as a test Student account.

ResponsesInList.Title: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: I really like the style and options of H5P's plugin and activities , but I was reading that someone could link answers to H5P quizzes, etc., could be tracked like other activities for each student/user. I was wondering how to do this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Austin, in order to track H5P activities , you have to install the H5P plugin in Moodle. If you embed the content created with the H5P authoring tool, the activity is not tracked. With the H5P plugin, any activity created from there is included in any type of reports, such as activity report or gradebook. Cheers, Beatriz

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for the reply. I do have the plugin installed. I would like to use the Course Presentation activity since I can include many other H5P activities in there. I am not very familiar with how activity tracking works in Moodle yet, but if a student did some activities in that course presentation, would their results be recorded somewhere? Could you direct in to where I could find their answers? I am building a training application, so their grades are not as important as understanding the answers they give (so we can improve on it). Thank you so much for help. - Austin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Austin, now I understand your question better . It's a good question. I've never tracked the results on an H5P activity, only the participation and completion. But I guess if you poke around Users>Reports, you'd be able to see the answers a user entered. Or maybe also using the gradebook? Sorry that I cannot help more.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Entering the h5P activity from the gradebook (instead of from the course page) will show the teacher an overview of how the students have done. Not sure if it shows answers or not, but check it out and let us know what you see

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you! I finally managed to figure it out. Moodle's documentation talks about a gradebook setup by going to grades in administration, but it is not there (I'm using Moodle 3.7). What I did find is that there is a Grades button the sidebar AFTER selecting the course. As an admin, I was able to see all the H5P results and answers from each user. That's exactly what I was looking for.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for sharing your outcomes, Austin! Could you take a screenshot of that part of the interface? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, of course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities

Is it possible or I am looking in the wrong places? I have looked in the gradebook and in the activity itself. Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Keeping track of progress in H5P activities
ResponsesInList.Text: If you reference the H5P documentation for Questionnaire you will see it says It does not save data, but that it can pass data to a Learning Record Store system.

is any smaller, or change the video size in the content creator? I'm using Moodle core 3.8.2. Best regards, Cobus van Loggerenberg

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Interactive Video
ResponsesInList.Text: My understanding is that because H5P is an HTML5 object, it will expand to show as large as it can. So, if you wanted to display the movie at a smaller size, maybe you could create a (hidden) table and embed it in there?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Interactive Video
ResponsesInList.Text: Cool, thanks for your response. I am a total noob so appreciate every input. Would you be so kind as to elaborate how would I do this. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Interactive Video
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry, it's not a technical answer. I just meant using a table to constrain the width of an object - basic HTML. These days people use 's of course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Interactive Video
ResponsesInList.Text: CSS using a max-height and max-width would also achieve your goal and you would add this to the template. Somewhere in your theme template should be a place for custom CSS.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Big images | Small images
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Kees, With most content types, when media are added, there is an option labelled 'Disable image zooming'. If this is unchecked a picture is normally shown as a smaller size with a button to enlarge them. Checking it makes it fullscreen always.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduled task to Download available H5P content types ERROR
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! I tried the "Run now" but to no avail. I was wondering what would happen if I'd just uninstall the core H5P from our Moodle site and install the plug-in from here instead: https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_hvp Any thoughts on what could possibly be the result and is the H5P that comes by default any different from the one downloadable on Moodle.org?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduled task to Download available H5P content types ERROR
ResponsesInList.Text: You can uninstall (or disable) the core activity, but this does not really affect the content types as they are part of the content bank which is in the core. However, you can install and use the module above and it should work independently. I had similar problem and fixed it by retrieving the pathnamehash report in the error message above and deleting the files table entry corresponding to it with an SQL command. If it is a production system it needs to be taken offline and backed up if you do that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ri: Re: Scheduled task to Download available H5P content types ERROR SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle 3.8.4 Me too getting the same error. "Duplicate entry '88b06733853c58c1ef1f0091cbac4e336fda5734' for key 'mdl_file_pat_uix'" I solved it this way: On "Atto toolbar settings" I click on "Uninstall the plugin "Insert H5P" but not completely, only for the first part. And then reinstalled. The error is gone.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to add a H5P activity in the course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, When adding an H5P activity, for package file, click the Add... icon, then in the file picker you can browse and select your H5P content in the content bank. For further details, please see the documentation H5P activity .

ResponsesInList.Title: Manage h5p in the content bank?

The content bank looks a bit like a repository browser, but it's not. he current process for cloning content isn't that obvious: open a package by clicking on it click on EDIT, as if you wanted to change that package press the copy button at the top press CANCEL press CLOSE to go back to the content bank. use the add button and scroll around in the list till you find the same content type (why isn't this an autocomplete type box?) and click that type Click on the 'Paste' button at the top and agree with the dialogue. There's your clone. Go back to step 6 and discover it doesn't matter which type you chose because you're going to overwrite it anyway. Ok so now I've made my copy and I realised that I don't need it any more. I'll just delete it again. I'll click the package I'll click, eh, maybe edit? Scroll around a while ... can't see anything maybe at the bottom? no? can't see a way to delete Oh wait a minute ... go to the themes control and switch to Boost Now there's a cog menu and underneath it a drop down with Delete Phew! Wow these copies are getting out of control. I'll just go organise them into folder with nice version names or something uh ... click on the folder icon? oh. oh I see. Well, big old list of Presentation Actviity (copy) (copy) version 2 final (copy) Final version it is then. I might as well just have the files in dropbox and set it up as repository. I like the idea of content bank, and the fact that there might one day be other types of content libraries that can be added not just h5p.

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Content Types and foreign languages
ResponsesInList.Text: The language element in Content Types are not translated with Moodle language files. They are translated in H5P language system. https://localization.h5p.org/ I couldn't identify how we can use them in our Moodle sites? Any advices would be helpful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Content Types and foreign languages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Ralf, The language files are loaded when the content is created. The strings used in the editor are localized (select desired language in Moodle before editing). When the content is saved those strings are saved as the ones that will be used for the content, and they do not change after that if a student has a different language preference. If you are creating a multilingual course you would likely need to create a different content for each language.

I know that the German elements in the screen are from German Moodel H5P language pack and the content type strings are from H5P localization pack. The German pack is¬† translated complete. I could not identify the reason why the German language elements from H5P content objects are not loaded. What is the mechanism that loads, updates such files? Ralf

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Content Types and foreign languages
ResponsesInList.Text: When I try to add a Dictation type with German language preference, everything appears in German for me I do not see a mixture although I do on image pairing for example. I am using Moodle 3.9 with the new standard plugins. I updated the content types through the admin page recently so it should most recent versions of all the libraries. Which version are you using? The reason that there are mixtures of stings is that the lang files are found in the content types or the libraries that are used by the content type. Each library has its own set of strings and language files. Evidently some of the libraries installed are missing the German file on your system. You might try running the cron task to see if it updates them if you are on 3.9.

ResponsesInList.Title: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, do you know of any security implications of letting students upload H5P content through the Atto editor, or in general? It comes by default on Moodle 3.9. Can they SPAM , crosscript or freeze other students' browsers with malicious H5P content? Is it even possible to create malicious H5P content? Best, Fabian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Fabian, as standard settings, the student role doesn't have access to the content bank, i.e. they cannot create any H5P content. I have checked and, in the case of an essay question, the Atto editor doesn't display the H5P button in a student role, so there are no security issues in this regard. But the best would be to create and dummy student account and check how is the role configured in your site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Beatriz. I didn't think of login in as a student to see if the button appeared or not. Apparently it doesn't appear by default for the student role in the Atto. Thank you! Best, Fabian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: It is possible to create a malicious content type, but new content types have to uploaded by a system administrator. It can not be done by normal users. Javascript is loaded from the content types. When editing content users can really only change plain text. The H5P filter allows users to include content from external sites, but only those on a list specified by the admin as safe. It is possible that malicious code is on one of those sites if the admin is not careful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security implications of H5P in Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Daniel, That was very useful too. Best, Fabian

ResponsesInList.Title: Permissions for students to create H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: I have spend a few hours tweaking roles and permissions on a development Moodle with the goal to have students create their own H5P content from within a Moodle course but no luck so far.¬† I got close by allowing student role to manage activities (moodle/course:manageactivities) but that created additional unintended results in that students could manage other activities as well. I am on Moodle version 3.9. In addition, I looked at database activity but students only seem to be able to supply a link to H5P content but neither upload it nor create it. In Forum activity, .h5p files can be added by the student role which is good but does not meet my needs. I am curious what I should be looking or searching for next to find a way to have students create H5P in Moodle (just like a teacher can). I don't want to send students to H5P.org Thank you in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Permissions for students to create H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: If you want students to be 'Teachers' in a certain context , isn't that better achieved by using the Assign Roles options, rather than editing the Role itself? e.g. if you want Students to be Teachers, in a specific Course, you can make them Teachers in that Course. Making Students into Teachers within a Courses in a specific context is also possible. But if you edit the Student Role, to give them moodle/course:manageactivities capability then anyone with the Student Role will have that permission and capabilities EVERYWHERE they are enrolled as a Student ! Is that really what you want ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Permissions for students to create H5P content
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dirk, The H5P editor in 3.9 works in the content bank. The content bank is in the course context so there is only one per course. If you allow students to access it they will be able to use all the content there (belonging to other students), but you can restrict them to editing there own content. If that is okay, students should be able to then include any of the content in other activities like wiki or glossary entries using the H5P filter. You do not need to use the H5P activity unless you need to have results of the activity recorded in grade book (which students should not normally access).

ResponsesInList.Title: H5P Quiz (Question Set) content type example
ResponsesInList.Text: A few weeks ago I shared an example of using Flashcards to make a "Guess the animals" exercise. I've been testing out different H5P content types, with much the same material, to explore the strengths and weaknesses of each.¬†So next I've tried the same questions, but this time using the H5P Quiz (Question Set). So here I'm sharing the "Guess the animals" H5P quiz.¬†Feel free to try it out - my kids really enjoy these. https://elearningworld.h5p.com/content/1290877973286713379 The criteria for building this content is: Must work well on a mobile phone - this is a game we play while out and about, in a cafe, etc. Have high quality images (some of the free Apps I found previously have really poor animal photos) Feature genuine learning opportunities through pop-up tips, help text etc. Be easy to use, navigate and read for children - my target audience initially being my daughters aged 4 and 6 Must be fun! Given my criteria above, I've created all the questions as multiple choice, but with just two options. Younger learners can practice their reading as they can sound out the first letter of the two options, and click on the correct choice. As with the Flashcards I've attributed everything correctly, so if you want to use this content in some way please do! Any feedback on errors, omissions, or any type of improvement please let me know Note that the H5P Quiz (Question Set) allows for randomisation, which the H5P Flashcards does not. The ability to zoom in on the image is very cool too ! Stu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Quiz (Question Set) content type example
ResponsesInList.Text: Love it Stuart! I will do it with my 6-year-old boy and give you some feedback! Cheers, Ben

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Quiz (Question Set) content type example
ResponsesInList.Text: Cool - thanks !

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Quiz (Question Set) content type example
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stuart, This was a really educational and fun game for my 6-year-old son. He found it really engaging. He didn't know a few of the incorrect animals so that was good because he learnt some new animals. But also it was good for him to read words, for instance, after a couple of times through, I got him to read the correct animal to recognise the written words. Also, I followed up getting him to do some writing of the animal's names. He is still forming his letters so that was useful. He really enjoyed it and it provided an excellent learning opportunity. Again, well done!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: H5P Quiz (Question Set) content type example
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, thanks for that feedback Benjamin - so glad to hear your son had fun ! I've been trying out various combinations of Quiz, Dialog Cards, Flashcards, etc. wit my daughters (4 and 6) to see which work best on a smartphone, and which they enjoy best - and then I think about the educational and learning benefits - just like you have with the follow-on writing. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Content Types in new integration
ResponsesInList.Text: Ramon, my understanding with 3.5 is that you can do some management of the content types when using the plugin but it takes some set-up. It is best if you limit who can add a content type in the first place because once they are added it is not straightforward to remove an unwanted one - here is some info from a Slack discussion I was having: "Content types are activated and upgraded in the activity editor within a course. There is not an option to remove a content type once activated. With capabilities you can limit content type management and just have you admins do it. You can do some library management at the admin settings level, including "restricting" libraries. We have used this feature to take away a content type that was accidentally or dependency activated, e.g. appear.in for Chat and Talk."
